loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jeans and sneakers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, a businesswoman from Liberia, is single and has three children between the ages of 6 and12. Her children are currently attending school and living at home. Victoria completed the 12th grade before starting her business. She lives and works in St. Paul, home to the oldest market in Liberia and known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas where many residents live in substandard housing. 
Victoria has a table business and has been selling local soap for the past seven years. She works eight hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is inadequate income. She intends to use the loan to buy local soap for her business. She started her business by selling to her friends. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She hopes to one day own a house.  
Victoria thanks you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy local soap for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 35-yr-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 2 children, age 12 & 5 yrs. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.  In 2011, Fatmata established her sugar, mayonnaise, sardines, powdered milk, etc. business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more sugar, milk, sardines, etc. for resale. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a bigger shop, educate her children and build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, milk, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Vickey

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Vickey from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for fresh fish as it is located by the ocean. However, it is also one of the poorer areas and housing quality is often very low. 
Vickey is single with three children, including two who live at home and go to school. Her spouse works as teacher. Vickey has a business where she sells bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc from a table.  She has been in business for five years and works nine hours a day. She transports her goods by taxi. With this loan, she will buy bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income. She started her business with money from her susu (saving club). She is proud of her business because she makes a profit. Her plan is to build a house.  She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Hawa. She is married and has 2 children, ages 16 and 21 years. Hawa has 2 additional dependents who live with her for assistance in schooling. 

In 2002, Hawa established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish to sell and get more profit. She will use some of the money on transportation. 

Hawa planned to educate her children to university level and to construct a mini-cool room in her village. She was successful in educating her children and she is still planning to build a mini-cool room in the future through the profit that she makes. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish for resale.

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (love and hope) 1 & 2. This group is located in a rural area of La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She says that her dream is to have her own house, and thanks to the loan and her savings, she has made it possible to plan it.

Maritza is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for almost six years, starting to sell products. Maritza plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business and provide for her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothes and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Vidalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vidalia tiene 43 años de edad, esta acompañada y es madre de 4 hijos. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su compañero de vida que se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y cuidarlas y  ella se  prepara para ir a  vender frutas y verduras en la ciudad  y en la tarde se dirige a la  parcela donde cultivan junto a su compañero de vida.   

Ella compra las cosechas de aguacate, mango, naranja, etc en los cantones aledaños a su residencia; ya que le sale mas barato.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos  vacas lecheras; ya que actualmente posee tres vacas; para producir queso y crema para la venta. Con la venta de lácteos mejorara su negocio lo que le generara mejores ingresos para el sustento de su familia. ella planea en un futuro poder construir su vivienda; ya que actualmente es de lamina.
texts.en:
Vidalia is 43 years old and is the mother of 4 children. She makes a living tending a parcel of land with her husband. Every morning, she and her husband wake up at 5:00 a.m. to milk their cows, and Vidalia gets ready to take fruits and vegetables into the city center for sale. In the afternoons, Vidalia and her husband return to their land to tend their crops.

In order to get the best prices, Vidalia purchases various fruits and vegetables from her neighbors for resale in the city center. The produce she purchases for resale includes avocados, mangos and oranges.

With the support from this loan, Vidalia plans to purchase two dairy cows. She and her husband currently have three dairy cows they milk in order to make cheese and cream for resale. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her business and improve her family's quality of life as well as their house, which is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Kevin Gustavo

texts.es: Kevin, con 24 años de edad es una persona desplazada, víctima de la violencia, por lo que tuvo que trasladarse y dejar toda su vida y sus cosas en el pueblo donde residía, incluyendo los galpones donde criaba pollos para venta, que era su actividad generadora de ingresos. Luego de dos años, sin poder conseguir empleo, decide reiniciar la actividad, para lo cual requiere el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará 1.000 pollos y los insumos para construir los galpones (madera, mallas, clavos) y compra de concentrado para los animales (cuido), con esto podrá salir de la difícil situación en la que se encuentra y generar nuevamente ingresos para sus sustento diario.  Kevin sueña con tener su negocio bien establecido como lo tenía antes de la violencia, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar la calidad de vida personal y familiar.
texts.en: Kevin is 24 years old and is a displaced person, a victim of violence, for which he had to move and leave his whole life and all of his possessions in the town where he lived, including the sheds where he raised chickens for sale, which was the work that generated his income.  After two years, without being able to find work, he decided to reinitiate his work with chickens, which is why he requires a loan. He will use it to buy 1000 chickens and the materials in order to build the coups (wood, nails, mesh netting) and to purchase concentrated feed for the animals. With this he will be able to get out of the difficult situation in which he finds himself and to generate new income for his daily sustenance.  Kevin dreams of having his own well established business like what he had before the violence, which will permit him a favorable and stable income in order to improve his personal and familial quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 1000 chickens and the materials in order to build the coups (wood, nails, mesh netting) and to purchase concentrated feed for the animals.

loans.name: Maria Antonina

texts.es:
Doña María Antonina tiene 52 años de edad ella es ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 2 hijos y en compañía de sus esposo se dedican a la agricultura en la siembra de café. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que en su familia es una tradición y la practican de generación en generación siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y hoy en día en compañía de su esposo. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y a la dedicación puesta por muchos años de trabajo.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para invertirlo en la limpia, mantenimiento, fertilización, abono para sus cultivos de café ya que es necesario dar esta clase de asistencia para hacer sus cultivos atractivos para sus clientes y demás compradores.

Sus planes son poder dar la asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos para poder sacar un producto de calidad y provechoso. Sus sueños como madre es poder darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad, contar con una familia estable y con las ganancias re invertir en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Maria Antonina, 52, is a housewife and a farmer and has 2 children. Together with her husband, they grow coffee. She has a lot of experience in this activity because it is a tradition in her family, practiced from generation to generation. Her parents taught her how to work the land and now she does it with her husband. They own the land they cultivate thanks to their effort and dedication over many years.
Maria Antonina is asking for financing through the field partner, COMIXMUL, to invest in cleaning, maintenance, fertilization and manure for her coffee crops. This type of assistance is necessary to make her crops attractive to her customers and other buyers.
Her plans are to give assistance and maintenance to her crops to obtain a quality and profitable product. Her dreams as a mother are to provide a good quality education for her children, to have a stable family and to reinvest her profits in the coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 42-year-old trader who lives in Teshie, Ghana. She has two children. She sells smoked fish, which is the only source of income for the family. Rebecca's husband helps her in the smoking and sales of the fish. She is interested in offering more variety of fish to her customers which will help her to increase her net income and savings as well. However, due to insufficient finances, she finds it difficult. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner ID-Ghana so that she can buy and sell different fish to serve her customers better. With the profit, she wants to grow her business in the future. This is her second loan request from Kiva and she is very thankful to Kiva and ID-Ghana.

Rebecca is standing on the right in the photograph. Her fellow group member, Christiana, on the left, is a scarf and wax-print seller.

loans.use: to buy and sell different varieties of fish so that she can serve customers better.

loans.name: Mercedes Maricela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 63 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad que son casados. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Mercedes al ver que su marido no ganaba mucho en el campo en prendió un pequeño negocio  que le permite sacar adelante su hogar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, detergentes, etc. también vende carne, pescado y quesos. Trabaja todos los días brindando la mejor atención a sus clientes ya que esta es la forma como ella gana más clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir aun más su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Su sueño es aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Nueva Ilusión" (New Hope) meets every two weeks in Calí, which is located in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is known for its hardworking people, the majority of whom make a living working in agriculture and raising cattle.

Mercedes, at 63 years of age, is a member of the group and has three grown, married children. Her husband makes a living as a farmer. When Mercedes realized that her husband's income was not going to cover their household expenses, she decided to open a small convenience store and generate additional, much needed income. At her store, Mercedes sells various food and household items, including: oil, rice, detergents, meat, fish, cheeses, etc. She works 7 days a week and always tries to give every single customer the best service possible.

With the support from this loan, Mercedes plans to purchase merchandise to stock her convenience store. She is a founding member of the Community Bank, and she is grateful for the support she has received from the institution. Her dream is to strengthen and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Modesta Andrea

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora Modesta, tiene 58 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. 

Doña Modesta  para obtener sus propios recursos se  dedica al comercio, vende productos para el hogar como: (licuadoras, planchas, ventiladores, colchones, entre otros) a través de cartillas de la distribuidora La Gran Cadena, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, lleva en este negocio por más de 16 años con el cual ella ha podido salir adelante en sus gastos y también ayuda a sus padres.

Este crédito es para comprar licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otros artefactos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. 

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of Crucita Communal Bank meet in the parish of Crucita in Portoviejo Canton.  The town is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it.  Tourists from around the country and the world visit there.  It's known as Crucita la Bella [Beautiful Crucita].

This is where Modesta lives.  She's 58 years old and single, and lives in her parents' house.

Modesta works as a merchant to earn her own resources.  She sells household products (blenders, irons, fans, mattresses, and other things) via savings books from the La Cadena distributorship.  She sells door-to-door.  She has been in the business for more than 16 years and has been able to get ahead in her expenses as well as help her parents.

This loan is to buy blenders, irons, mattresses, and other appliances.

She's a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the help the loans always provide.  Her dreams are to have good health and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy blenders, irons, mattresses, and other appliances

loans.name: Celia Maritza

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis  hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  estudian en la universidad y viven con ella además de una nieta que es como su hija. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Celia tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también legumbres y ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, ella también tiene unas cabinas telefónicas en el cual además de ofrecer el servicio de llamadas también realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras. Trabaja todo el día desde las 6 am hasta las 18h00 y hasta más tarde a veces, ella tiene más de 14 años con sus negocios con los cual se gana algo que les ayuda mucho ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar víveres ya que con los créditos ella aumenta el negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su meta es tener un local mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
In the town of Cadi in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank "Nueva Illusion" meet every 15 days.  This is a place that is known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and livestock production.

This is where Celia, 48, lives.  She is married, and she and her husband have 6 grown children.  Two of the children study at the university and live with her, along with a granddaughter who is like a daughter to her.  Celia's husband works as a farmer.

Celia has a small store where she sells all types of basic consumer goods such as: vegetables, housewares, and stationery.  She also has some telephone cabins, and sells cell phone recharges from various cellular providers.  She works every day from 6am until 6pm, and even later some days.  She's had this store for more than 14 years, and with her businesses she generates earnings that are a big help to her family, since her husband doesn't earn very much from his work in the fields.

Celia will use this loan to buy groceries, because she wants to expand her business.  She is a founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that is provided with these loans.

Celia's goal is to have a much bigger store.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis a sus 44 años de edad es casado y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como reciclador, además cría cerdos para la venta y los días domingo y lunes alterna con la venta de mercancía en un pueblo; estas actividades son la que le generan los ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. El titular es un hombre emprendedor, trabajador y dedicado a su familia y a su labor, siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esta razón solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de reciclaje al por mayor (cartón, papel archivo, latas, cobre) para venderlo directamente a las chatarrerías mayoristas, sin intermediarios y así tener un margen de utilidad más alto, para poder continuar sustentando las necesidades de su familia. Luis tiene como meta principal velar porque sus actividades sean rentables y perdurables en el tiempo, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years, is married, and without children.  Currently, he works in recycling.  He also raises pigs to sell and on Sundays and Mondays sells merchandise in his village.  These jobs are how he makes the income he needs to take care of his family's daily needs.  He is an enterprising and hardworking man who is dedicated to his family and his work.  He is always on the lookout for ways to get ahead.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan so he can buy recycling wholesale (cardboard, newspaper, cans, and copper).  He resells them directly to wholesale junkyards without any middlemen.  In this way, he obtains more profits that he uses to keep meeting the needs of his family.  Luis' main goal is to keep going as is, because his work is going well and is dependable.  By so doing, he will improve the quality of life of his family and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: buy recycling wholesale (cardboard, newspaper, cans, and copper).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two mules for transporting goods.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Doña Delfina con 33 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, casada y agricultora que en compañía de su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de viveros de café y cultivos del mismo. Ella realizo sus estudios hasta el sexto grado y agradece el esfuerzo y apoyo económico. Sus hijos el mayor tiene 17 años quien también curso solo el sexto grado no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de apoyo económico y decidió irse para EE.UU para poder ayudar a sus hermanos y a sus padres, la segunda hija tiene 15 años y también tomo el mismo camino de su hermano mayor, la tercera tiene 13 años y con el apoyo de sus 2 hermanos mayores y  padres está cursando el primer año de ciclo común, la cuarta hija tiene 10 años y está  en cuarto grado y la quinta hija tiene 08 años y está cursando el segundo grado. Las tierras que trabajan en compaña de su esposo están ubicadas a 3 minutos de camino y eso le permite estar más atenta y cuidadosa de sus cultivos de café.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de Chapola (plantita de café) para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros para poder cuidar y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos.  

Sus planes para el futuro es comprar más terrenos cultivados de café y así forjar un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos para obtener más ganancias y tener una mejor condición de vida. Sus sueños como madre es que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales cursando carreras universitarias para enfrentar con conocimiento los problemas económicos de manera favorable
texts.en:
Delfina, 33, is married and has 5 children. She is a farmer and together with her husband, they have a coffee plant nursery and also grow coffee. She studied until 6th grade (age 11) and is grateful for the financial support. Her eldest son is 17. He only studied until 6th grade as well, and couldn't keep studying due to lack of funding. He decided to move to the U.S.A. to be able to help his siblings and his parents. The second daughter is 15 and she followed the same route as her elder brother. The third daughter is 13 and thanks to the support from her older siblings and parents is studying in secondary school. The fourth daughter is 10 and is studying 4th grade and the youngest, 8 years old, is in second grade.
The lands that Delfina and her husband work are a 3-minute walk from home and this allows Delfina to pay attention and care for her coffee crops.
She is asking for a loan through the field partner, COMIXMUL, to purchase young coffee plants (known as "chapolas"), manure, fertilizers, etc. in order to care for and maintain her crops.
Her future plans are to buy more lands with coffee crops and generate an estate for her children, increase their income and have better life conditions. As a mother, her dream is that her children go to university and become trained professionals so that they will be able to face economic problems in a favorable way.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gladis Adriana

texts.es: Gladis, con 34 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Su vida productiva la ha empleado, trabajando en un negocio de comidas rápidas que tuvo durante muchos años, pero que tuvo que culminar, cuando se cambió de casa con su familia; dejando la carga económica a su esposo. Por falta de oportunidades laborales y, motivada por sacar adelante a su familia, ella decidió retomar el negocio de la venta de comidas rápidas y ubicarlo en la acera de su casa, para lo cual requiere el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará un carro de perros por valor de $800.000 e insumos (panes, papas, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas) por valor de $200.000 para un total de $1.000.000; esto le permitirá generar ingresos para apoyar la carga económica de su hogar, ya que solo depende de su esposo que es obrero de construcción y la economía familiar es muy inestable porque esa labor es muy incierta. Gladis sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, que sea estable y perdurable en el tiempo, de esta forma podrá generar los recursos para apoyar el sustento familiar, brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de todos con una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Gladis, age 34, has two children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her life partner.  She has used her life productively by working in a fast food business that she had for many years.  However, she had to stop when she moved houses with her family, which left the financial burden to her husband.  Due to the lack of work opportunities, and motivated to get her family ahead, she decided to take up her fast food business again.  She set it up on the sidewalk to her house.

That is why she needs the support of the loan to buy a hot dog cart for 800,000 COP and supplies (bread, potatoes, cold meats, salsas, and soft drinks) for 200,000 COP for a total of 1,000,000 COP.  This will allow her to generate income to contribute to her household’s financial responsibilities.  This is because she depends only on her husband, a construction worker.  The family’s finances are very unstable because this work is not very consistent.

Gladis dreams of giving continuity to her business, that it becomes stable, and that it lasts long-term.  This way she will be able to generate the resources to support the family, to give her children a better quality education, and to improve the quality of life for all of them with good financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a hot dog cart and supplies like bread, potatoes, cold meats, salsas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nelida Sthela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadi de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelida, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 18, 17, 14 y 11 años, todos estudian uno en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Nelida es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas y productos de Yanbal y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cremas ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a aumentar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ilusión” communal bank meets in Calí every two weeks. Calí is located in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its hardworking people. Many of them make a living working in agriculture and raising cattle.

Nelida is 36 years old. She is married and she has four children who are 18, 17, 14 and 11. They are all studying. One child is in university and the rest are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Nelida is a housewife who has to earn her own means of support. With these earnings, she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells sheets as well as Yanbal and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days a week for two to three hours. She sells her products on credit and she is paid on a weekly basis. She has had this business for eight years and it is going very well. She sells perfumes and creams most often since they are very good.

This loan is for purchasing sheets, perfumes, creams and cosmetic. She has been in this communal bank for four years. She likes the bank because the loans have helped he expand her business.

Her dream is to purchase a vehicle to sell her products.

loans.use: purchase sheets, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.en:
Umbelina lives in a town with her family; she takes care of two chickens, one pig, and her garden. 

Umbelina opened a kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital, and she generates a good income from selling stock at her store. 

A $1,000 loan has been offered to Umbelina to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, like wood-cutting tools, ogre, wood, and a quests machine (bandsaw). 

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in her existing business.

loans.use: To buy wood cutting tools, ogre, wood, quests machine/bandsaw

loans.name: Mujeres Renovadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Renovadas trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2010, es un grupo antiguo y trabajador, que está saliendo adelante gracias al esfuerzo de todas ellas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer como están cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Karen quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, eso quiere decir que tiene ingresos mensuales muy escasos. Ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, en lo que le está yendo muy bien gracias a que es una persona muy hábil en las ventas.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropa y calzados de temporada lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo para ir mejorando su vida y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Renovadas” (Renovating Women) has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2010.  It’s a long-standing, hardworking group that’s getting ahead thanks to the efforts each one of them.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to determine how each one of them is.

One of the members is Karen who in the previous survey fell in level one, that is to say, very low monthly income.  She works selling clothes and shoes and is doing very well in this because she’s a very skilled saleswoman.

She requests the loan to buy seasonal clothes and shoes which will help her realize her business plan that will help her improve her income.  All of them are grateful for the opportunity they are getting to improve their lives and income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es: Antonio es un hombre de 66 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos; actualmente vive con su esposa y su hija menor. Se dedica a la producción de arepas de maíz asadas al carbón, actividad que realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años cuando lo inició de una manera humilde, pues las asaba sobre una rejilla pequeña y las llevaba en una caja para venderlas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, su hija menor y una empleada que contrata para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, ya que es reconocido por la buena calidad de sus productos y su clientela es fiel y muy selecta porque pagan los pedidos de contado; así es como obtiene los ingresos para sostener económicamente su hogar. El titular es trabajador, muy organizado y dedicado a su labor, ha encontrado apoyo con los créditos para mejorar su negocio, y por eso se motivó a solicitar el quinto ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (maíz por valor de $1.500.000 y carbón por $500.000) para aprovechar el descuento que le hacen y así tener materia prima disponible para cumplir con la producción de los pedidos que tiene pendientes y aumentar sus ingresos. Antonio sueña con ampliar su negocio, atender muchos más clientes ofreciéndoles un producto de excelente calidad que satisfaga sus necesidades y gustos, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 66-year-old man, married, and has 3 children. He lives with his wife and their youngest daughter. He makes a living by making corn tortillas roasted over charcoal, which he has been doing for about 15 years. He started modestly, roasting the tortillas over a small grill and carrying them in a box to sell them.

He counts on the help of his wife, his youngest daughter, and an employee who he hired in order to fill his customers' orders. He is recognized for the quality of his products, and his customers are loyal and very selective since they pay for their orders in cash; this is how he obtains the income to economically sustain his home.

Antonio is hard-working, very organized, and very dedicated to his work. He has received support from loans to improve his business, and that's what motivated him to request his fifth loan, which he will invest by purchasing supplies in bulk ($1.500.000 worth of corn and $500.000 worth of charcoal) to take advantage of the discount that he receives. This way, he will have raw materials available to fill the pending orders and increase his income.

Antonio dreams of expanding his business, reaching many more customers, and offering a very high-quality product that satisfies their needs and tastes. In this way, he will be able to increase his income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (1,500,000 COP worth of corn and 500,000 COP worth of charcoal).

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Jerlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and pig fattening. Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 40,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es: Diana, a sus 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 7 años. Su experiencia laboral la obtuvo cuando trabajó en una mina, pero se enfermó de paludismo y se retiró de su empleo; pero, la situación económica estaba muy difícil ya que el sustento de su hogar depende completamente de ella. Por esta razón y motivada para sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella, hace un año decidió montar una tienda de abarrotes con los ahorros que tenía, donde trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 10:00 de la noche, para conseguir los ingresos necesarios para darle el sustento a sus hijos; esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, quien siempre tuvo tiendas. La titular es una mujer luchadora, pujante y siempre va en busca de oportunidades para salir adelante, por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (enfriador y estanterías) y surtido (mecato, gaseosas, productos de aseo, productos lácteos, café y otros productos de la canasta familiar) con esto le dará continuidad a su negocio y tendrá disponibilidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, aumentando sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos; con esto, Diana podrá avanzar para cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos que es hacer crecer su negocio y generar recursos para poder seguir estudiando, y darle un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Diana is a 30-year-old single mother of three children aged 7, 11 and 12.  She gained work experience when she worked in a mine, but she became ill with malaria and retired from her job.  Her financial situation was then very difficult because her entire household is completely dependent on her for sustenance.  For this reason, and motivated to provide a better life for her children, one year ago she decided to open a grocery store with the savings that she had.  She works in the store from 6 am to 10 pm to earn the income necessary to support her children.  She learned the business from her father, who always had his own shops.

She is a strong, hardworking woman who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead.  For this reason she is seeking a loan to invest in her store.  She will use the funds to buy a cooler and shelves, as well as pastries, soft drinks, coffee, dairy products, cleaning products and other grocery items.  This will enable her to continue in her business and have products available to offer to her customers, and to increase her sales and ultimately her own income. She will be able to move closer to one of her main goals, which is to grow her business and generate resources so that she can keep studying and provide a better and healthier quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and shelves, as well as pastries, soft drinks, coffee, dairy products, cleaning products and other grocery items.

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Nancy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 57 years old and is widowed with 3 children. Ana Maria works very hard to provide for her children.

Ana Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as candies, cookies, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Ana Maria would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es: Juan con 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre, con quien aprendió la labor de la venta de raspados, ya que ella lleva varios años vendiendo el producto a las afueras de un colegio.  Por necesidad, falta de experiencia y falta de oportunidades laborales, él decide conseguir recursos por cuenta propia, por eso comenzó la venta de raspados, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en el pago de la máquina para hacer raspados con lo cual tendrá la posibilidad de generar ingresos para apoyar la carga económica en su hogar y cumplir el sueño de realizar una carrera universitaria, para tener un futuro prometedor y exitoso que le permita brindarle a su madre una estabilidad económica, bienestar y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 20 years old, single, and lives with his mother, with whom he learned how to sell shaved ice, as she has sold them for several years outside of a school. By necessity, lack of experience and lack of job opportunities, he decided to obtain his own resources, therefore he began selling shaved ice, but he requires the support of a loan to invest in the purchase of a machine to make shaved ice with which he will have the possibility of generating income in order to support his home economically and make real his dream of attending the university in order to have a promising and successful future that will enable him to provide his mother economic stability, well-being, and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying a machine to make shaved ice.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 48 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 51 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is in school. Betty works very hard to provide for her children.

Betty runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Betty has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, soft drinks, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jhosnairo

texts.es: Jhosnairo con 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y aún no tiene hijos.  Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia, debido a esto, hoy en día se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos, los cuales vende en el mercado y con esto obtiene los recursos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El prestatario es un hombre juicioso, trabajador, dedicado a su familia y a su labor, por esta razón solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su labor, el cual será invertido en la compra de cerdos y lechones para cría y engorde, con el fin de venderlos a un precio más alto y de esta manera incrementar las ganancias, de esta forma Jhosnairo podrá cumplir la meta de brindarle a su esposa una estabilidad económica y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar, para tener un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Jhosnairo is thirty years old and lives with his common-law wife.  They currently do not have children.  He has lived his entire life in the countryside, where he learned the business of farming, thanks to the efforts of his family. Because of this, he now has a business raising and fattening pigs, which he sells in the market.  From this he obtains the resources he needs in order to provide sustenance for his family.  

He is a hardworking and judicious man, dedicated to his family and his work.  For this reason he is seeking a loan so that he can continue with his work. He will invest the proceeds in pigs and piglets to raise and fatten, with the aim of selling them at a higher price, thus increasing his profits.  This will enable him to reach his goal of providing greater financial stability for his wife and a better quality of life in his household, so that they can have a successful and prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and piglets to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 38 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as oils, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, milk, sugar, and water. She makes good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.
 
Lucia lives near a school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people, including students, come to shop. She has a house with woven fiber walls and a zinc roof. She has planted a garden with papaya and corn. Her husband is in the army.

loans.use: To buy oils, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, milk, sugar, and water for her general store

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es: Flor, a sus 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió todas las labores agropecuarias y gracias a esto tiene experiencia en el manejo de ganado. Actualmente se dedica a la confección de algunas prendas, ya que sólo posee una máquina, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. La titular es una mujer emprendedora, activa y dedicada a su esposo y a sus hijos, razón por la cual lucha cada día para salir adelante, eso la motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una vaca productora de leche, ya que desea alternar la confección con la producción del líquido para conseguir recursos adicionales, además quiere aprovechar un pequeño lote con pasto que tiene en la finca donde reside y, la producción que saque, la venderá a sus vecinos y familiares. Con esto podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un taller de confección grande, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo  y mejorar la calidad de vida y la economía de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Flor is 42 years old, married, and mother to 4 children. She has lived in the country her entire life, where she learned all the agriculture and livestock jobs and thanks to this upbringing she has experience managing cattle. today she makes clothing, as she only has one machine with which she obtains income to support her family. She is a enterprising woman, active and dedicated to her husband and children; they are the reason she fights every day to get ahead and that motivated her to seek a loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of a cow that will produce milk, as she would like to alternate her clothing making with the milk production in order to obtain additional income. In addition she wants to take advantage of a small pasture that the farm has where she lives, and she will sell the production she gets to her neighbors and acquaintances. With this she will be able to advance toward her main dream which is to open a large seamstress shop that will enable her to generate opportunities for employment and improve her quality of life and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Sulma Melissa

texts.es:
Sulma es una joven de 25 años de edad casada y en compañía de su esposo se dedica a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café. Es madre de 2 hijos un bebe de 8 meses de nacido y una niña de 7 años la cual está en primaria y viven juntos en familia. Ella aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura decidió también emprender un negocio para fortalecer los ingresos mensuales el cual es un negocio de ropa nueva y usada. Fueron sus padres quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra siendo en su familia una tradición y las tierras que trabaja son propias gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres. Sus clientes son bodegas que exclusivamente se dedican a la compra-venta de café en otras localidades.

Ella ha solicitado ayuda para la compra de chapola (plantita de café), abono, fertilizantes para la siembra y mantenimiento del café que ya está cultivado.

Sus metas es que sus cultivos sean los mejores de la localidad haciéndolos atractivos y mejores ya que con ello ella mejorara sus ingresos económicos. Uno de sus sueños es poder continuar sus estudios en la universidad cursando una licenciatura en inglés y que su esposo también pueda continuar ya que él está estudiando a distancia ciclo común.
texts.en:
Sulma is 25 years old, married, and with the company of her husband, makes a living in agriculture by planting and growing coffee. She has two children, an 8 month old baby, and a seven year old girl who is in school and lives with the family.  Separate from her work, she also decided to start a business to increase her monthly income.  This business is for new and used clothing. 

Her parents were the type who taught her to work the land when she was very young. It was a family tradition, because working lands are owned thanks to an inheritance from her parents. Her customers are grocery stores that exclusively focus on the buying and selling of coffee in other locations. 

She is requesting this loan to buy coffee plants, manure, fertilizers for planting, and to maintain the coffee that is already cultivated. Her goal is have her crops be the best in the locality, the best made and most attractive. With these, she can improve her economical income. One of her dreams is to continue her studies at the university, pursuing a degree in English, and that her husband can also continue his distance learning semester.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants, manure, and fertilizers to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of nine children, Elesia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.  Elesia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

Elesia has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 56 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, seasonings, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es: Angélica, a sus 19 años de edad es madre de un hijo y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a la fabricación y comercialización de quesos, actividad que aprendió al lado de sus padres y con la cual genera ingresos para aportar al sustento familiar y a satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su pequeño hijo. Es una joven luchadora, emprendedora, con visión y muchas ganas de progresar, su familia es la principal motivación para levantarse día a día desde las 6:00 de la mañana para comenzar con su trabajo y elaborar sus productos, luego sale a venderlos a sus vecinos y en las tiendas del sector donde reside, sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentan por falta de capital de trabajo. Por esta razón, solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en materia prima al por mayor (leche de vaca) para darle continuidad a su negocio y tener disponibilidad de productos para cumplir con los pedidos que le realicen, así tendrá la oportunidad de vender más y generar más ingresos. Así, Angélica avanzará un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño, que es montar una empresa de lácteos, con todas las especificaciones y requisitos legales y de salubridad, en el cual pueda generar oportunidades de empleo para otras personas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Angélica is 19 and lives with her common-law husband and their son.  She currently has a business making and selling cheeses.  She learned this activity from her parents.  This business generates income to support her family and meet the basic needs of her young son.  She is a hardworking and enterprising young woman, who has vision and his highly motivated to get ahead.  Her family is her main reason for getting up day after day at 6 am to start her work and make her products.  She sells her goods to her neighbors and to the shops in the area where she lives.  She is able to overcome the obstacles that result from a lack of working capital.

For this reason she is seeking a loan, which she intends to use to buy milk at wholesale in order to provide continuity for her business.  This will enable her to have enough products to comply with the orders she is receiving, and thus she will have the opportunity to sell more and generate more income.  In doing this, she will come one step closer to fulfilling her dream, which is to open a shop selling dairy products, complying with all of the legal and health requirements.  This would lead to opportunities to provide employment for other people and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Wilmar De Jesús

texts.es: Wilmar,  a sus 35 años de edad es casado y padre de 1 hijo. Hace 10 años y en compañía de su esposa se dedica a la actividad agrícola y tiene cultivos de diferentes productos, los cuales cosecha y vende en el mercado del pueblo, con lo cual ha generado ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia. El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante y día a día trabaja arduas jornadas para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan en la realización de su actividad, ha tenido situaciones difíciles debido a que el clima cambiante le ha dañado sus cultivos, sin embargo, con gran esfuerzo, esperanza y la motivación de su familia siempre ha salido adelante. En el momento solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, plaguicidas) y adicionalmente cancelará el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente. De esta forma podrá continuar con su labor y tendrá la posibilidad de cosechar productos en óptimas condiciones para venderlas a un mejor precio y así mejorará sus ingresos y podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y diversificar los cultivos para disminuir el riesgo al que se encuentra expuesto por factores externos, además podrá ofrecerle a su familia un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica para tener un futuro próspero.
texts.en: Wilmar is 35 years old, married, and father to 1 child. For 10 years he and his wife have farmed and they have different crops which he harvests and sells in the village market, with which he has generated income to support his family. He is a man with fight, thriving, and day after day working hard to overcome the obstacles in his path while working. He has had difficult situations due to the changing weather that has damaged his crops; nonetheless, with great effort, hope, and motivation from his family he has always been successful. Today he seeks a loan to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, herbicides) and also to pay off the balance of a current loan. In this way he will be able to continue working and will have the possibility of planting products during optimal conditions in order to sell them at a better price and in this way improve his income and be able to continue investing in his business and diversify the crops in order to reduce the risk and one encounters from external factors. In addition he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and economic stability in order to have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, herbicides) and also to pay off the balance of a current loan

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia is married, and she has four children She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family; she opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is also raising goats, buffalo, horses, pigs, and dogs around the house.  Leocadia has garden crops such as vegetables, papayas, corn, and bananas. 

Leocadia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as books, pans, water, coffee, sugar, milk, canned fish, snacks, and oils. She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. 

Leocadia is happy with this loan because to it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions for the future.

loans.use: To buy books, pans, water, coffee, sugar, milk, canned fish, snacks, and oils

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 50 años, estudió algunos años de la secundaria y luego decidió trabajar para ayudar con los gastos de su casa, es soltera tiene un hijo a quien apoya en sus estudios y vive con él en la Parroquia Valle Hermoso del cantón Santo Domingo en Ecuador. Valle Hermoso es una parroquia rural en donde hay aproximadamente siete mil habitantes, es el escenario para los amantes de los deportes extremos, pues sus cascadas y ríos son los recursos naturales más adecuados para esto. Es un sitio con clima cálido y sus habitantes tienen un espíritu emprendedor impresionante, pues aprovechan el clima para explotar la actividad agrícola con la cual se producen frutos como la piña, la palma africana, maracuyá y palmito. Además las actividades ganaderas, avícolas y porcinas son muy frecuentes en este sector. Las actividades comerciales también son muy frecuentes en el pueblo como es el caso de Luz quien desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos bajo pedido de catálogos. Luz ha ganado mucha experiencia en ventas y cobranzas, pues varias horas al día se dedica a la visita de clientes para ofrecer sus productos o para entregar los pedidos, también recorre las largas calles de la ciudad para cobrar los saldos pendientes y también ella poder pagar a sus proveedores. La experiencia le ha enseñado lo importante de siempre contar con aquellos productos que sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son mujeres, más necesiten o usen con frecuencia, es por ello que Luz desea incrementar su negocio comprando productos al por mayor, con lo que obtendrá mayores descuentos por parte de sus proveedores y también recibirá premios por su compra, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus utilidades y de esta forma mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su hijo, además de convertirse en una microempresaria de la industria de la belleza como siempre ha sido su sueño. La falta de capital ha sido su mayor obstáculo para que su negocio gire alrededor solo de un par de productos. Ahora gracias a Fundación Alternativa y la intervención de Kiva podrá obtener un préstamo financiado por varias personas alrededor del mundo que creen en ella y con quienes Luz está muy agradecida. 
Luz una mujer que es líder por naturaleza, está al frente del Grupo “El Rosario”, un grupo de 4 personas que se unieron tras el mismo objetivo; buscar apoyo para mejorar y crecer con el negocio que  emprendieron hace algunos años para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
Sus amigos emprendedores como ella; María Dolores, Manuel y Dina se dedican a diferentes actividades que son el sustento para cada día. María Dolores se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización y esta actividad le ayuda para la manutención de sus 6 hijos, necesita su parte del préstamo para comprar cerdos y alimento para ellos. Manuel es un hombre que a sus 65 años aún trabaja en la venta de madera y utilizará su parte del préstamo para mejorar su espacio de trabajo y comprar herramientas. En cambio Dina es una mujer de 57 años, y tiene una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad la cual ha sido el sustento para su familia durante varios años. Los integrantes de este grupo tienen en común el trabajo duro y esforzado que realizan cada día y que  sin embargo no ha sido causa para que alguno se dé por vencido, pues sus motivaciones personales y familiares les fortalecen para seguir adelante y luchar por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luz, 50, studied up to a few years in high school and then decided to start working to help with the household expenses. She is single and has one son who she supports.  He is studying and they live in Valle Hermoso parish in the Santo Domingo canton in Ecuador. 
Valle Hermoso is a rural parish with approximately 7,000 inhabitants. It is a good place for extreme sports lovers since its waterfalls and rivers are the natural resources most suited for this. It is a place with warm weather and the inhabitants have a very entrepreneurial spirit. They take advantage of the weather for farming and grow fruits such as pineapple, African oil palm, passion fruit and palmetto. Other popular ways to make a living  in this area are livestock, poultry and pig farming. 
Sales jobs are also very frequent such as in the case of Luz, who for several years has been selling cosmetics through mail order catalogs. Luz has gained a lot of experience in sales and collections. For several hours a day she visits clients to show them her products as well as to deliver orders. She also walks the long streets of the city to collect outstanding balances and to pay her suppliers. 
Experience has taught her the importance of always depend on the products that her clients, a majority women, mostly need or use with frequency. This is why Luz would like to increase her business to buy products at whole sale. This way she will receive bigger discounts from the suppliers and also get awards for her purchases which will help her to improve her profits and in this way improve life for her and her son. 
Also, becoming a small business woman in the cosmetics industry has always been her dream. Her biggest business hurdle has been the lack of capital and therefore only has a few products. Now, thanks to  Fundación Alternativa and Kiva ,she will be able to get a loan from several people from around the world who believe in her. Luz is very grateful. 
Luz who is a natural leader, is the head of the “El Rosario” Group.  This is a four person group who united behind the same objective, find help to improve and grow with the business they learnt to do a few years ago and improve the quality of life for them and their families. 
Her entrepreneur friends, just like her, María Dolores, Manuel and Dina, work different jobs in order to live day to day.
 María Dolores grows pigs to sell. This helps her support her six children. She needs her part of the loan to buy pigs and feed for them. 
Manuel  still works at 65, selling wood and will use his part of the loan to improve his work space and buy tools. 
Dina, is a 57 year old woman who has a convenience store which has helped support her family for many years. 
The members of this group have in common that they work hard work and they have not given up. Their personal and family motivations have made them stronger so they can keep moving ahead and fight for their dreams.

loans.use: to buy products at whole sale

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La Sra. Sara de 42 años está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores  que actualmente están estudiando, ella  inicio  su negocio con la Venta por Catalogo de  Topperware  y nos comenta que su negocio le ha  marchado muy bien dice que hace tandas  de recipientes, vasos, jarras, utensilios, refractarios y más las tanda las hace   por semana con las vecinas de su colonia o  con las maestras de la escuela de sus hijos y le ha ido muy bien es por eso que el día de hoy está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercancía y más variedad de vasijas Topperware ella  agradecerá el apoyo que se le pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Sara is 42 years old, and married with three children who are minors and go to school. She began her business selling Tupperware through catalogs, and tells us that her business is going very well. She says that she makes up batches of containers, cups, jars, utensils, oven-proof dishes, and more. She makes up these batches weekly with her neighbors or the teachers in her children's school. 

It has been going very well which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise and a greater variety of Tupperware containers. She is grateful for any support that can be given.

loans.use: to buy containers, cups, jars, and other merchandise that she needs

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 46 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Crisanta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Crisanta has been in this business for four years.

In the future Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar goods, etc.

loans.name: Manuel María

texts.es: Manuel es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde que era pequeño aprendió las labores del campo al lado de su familia y, gracias a eso hoy en día tiene cultivo de plátano y cría cerdos para la venta, esto le ha permitido obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Día a día lucha de manera incansable, para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan debido a factores externos como el invierno que causa inundaciones y algunas veces ha dañado los cultivos, pero poco a poco, con paciencia, esmero y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante, motivado por su familia. En el momento, el prestatario solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas)  para poder continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y lograr cosechar un producto con óptimas condiciones para venderlo en el mercado a un mejor precio, de esta forma podrá tener un margen de ganancia más elevado y podrá invertir más en su negocio, para lograr cumplir el sueño de tener siembra en las 4 hectáreas que tiene disponibles, pero que, por falta de capital no lo ha logrado. Así tendrá una estabilidad económica adecuada para brindar a sus hijos una buena educación, bienestar y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en: Manuel is the father of two children who are eight and four years old. He is in a common-law relationship. Since he was little, he learned farm work alongside his family. Thanks to that experience, he now grows bananas and raises pigs for sale. This has allowed him to earn income to support his family daily. Every day, he tirelessly fights to overcome the obstacles present due to external factors. The winter causes flooding and at times, it has damaged crops. However, little by little, with patience, great care and dedication, he has managed to succeed motivated by his family. At the moment, the borrower is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (fertilizers, seeds, pesticides). These products will allow him to continue caring for his crops and achieve a harvest with optimal conditions in order to sell his products at the market for a good price. With this work, he will be able to have a greater profit margin and he will be able to invest more in his business. He will be able to achieve his dream of having cultivated land on the four hectares he has available. Due to a lack of capital, he has not been able to achieve this. He will have adequate economic stability in order to give his children a good education, wellbeing and improve the quality of life for his entire family.

loans.use: purchase of farming supplies (fertilizers, seeds, pesticides).

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods like soap, shampoo, milk, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods like soap, shampoo, milk, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Kenne

texts.en:
Ma. Kenne is 44 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. 

Ma. Kenne is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs.

Ma. Kenne has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Kenne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 47 years old, married, with seven children, two of whom in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Primitiva has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 26000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Primitiva has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 51 years old and married with four children.

Narcisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase bread, chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Narcisa has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Narcisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Maricel has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase aditional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Julio Iván

texts.es: Julio con 32 años de edad, es soltero y padre de 2 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Hace un año, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comprar y vender cerdos, pues los obtiene, los cría, engorda y al momento de la venderlos los ofrece a un precio más alto, debido al peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones para engordarlos y venderlos, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. De esta manera, Julio espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julio, who is 32 years old, is single and the father of two children. During his productive life, he has worked for himself in a variety of businesses, generating income to sustain his family. A year ago, he got into the business of buying and selling pigs; he buys them, raises them, fattens them, and when it's time to sell them, he offers them at a higher price because of the weight the animal has gained. This allows him to obtain resources to continue caring for and providing for his children. 

The borrower is a strong and determined man. Motivated by his family, he strives every day to get ahead. This has inspired him to request this loan to invest in the purchase of pigs and piglets to fatten and sell so that he will be able to have enough stock to fill the orders that are coming in and improve his profit margin and income. In this way, Julio hopes to be one step closer to realizing his greatest dream, which is to formalize his business and set up a meat shop that will be profitable and enduring. He hopes to achieve economic stability in order to give his children the opportunity to have a better education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and piglets to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Fermín Antonio

texts.es: Fermín, a sus 58 años de edad es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Durante su vida productiva ha tenido experiencia laborando en una legumbrería durante muchos años, pero se retiró y hace 2 años tomó la decisión de independizarse y conseguir el sustento por cuenta propia, fue así como por medio de un amigo, aprendió la labor de fumigación, con la cual ha subsistido actualmente y labora en el tiempo en el que lo contratan. El titular es un señor amable, responsable, juicioso y entregado a su familia; por esta razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos de trabajo (venenos, pesticidas, plaguicidas) y además desea mejorar el vehículo en el en que se transporta para realizar los domicilios. Fermín cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado, pero sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y poder brindar más oportunidades laborales, además desea ofrecer a su familia y a sus hijos, una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fermín is 58 years old, married, and father of 2 children. During his productive life he has had many years of experience in a vegetable store but her retired 2 years ago and made the decision to work independently and obtain his own support. Thus through a friend, he learned about the fumigation business, which which he has supported himself today and he works when he is contracted. He is a friendly gentleman, responsible, sensible, and devoted to family. For this reason he seeks a loan to buy supplies for work (poisons, insecticides, pesticides) and to improve the vehicle he uses to make service calls. Fermín has the support of an employee, but he dreams of growing his business and being able to provide more job opportunities; in addition he wishes to offer his family and his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for work (poisons, insecticides, pesticides) and to improve his vehicle.

loans.name: Zoila Emperatriz

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y la menor tiene 11 años,  estudia en colegio y es la que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca pero en temporadas.

Doña Zoila es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The members of Crucita Communal Bank meet in the parish of Crucita in Portoviejo Canton. The town is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it. Tourists from around the country and the world visit there. It's known as Crucita la Bella [Beautiful Crucita].

This is where Zoila lives.  She's 45 years old and married, and has two children.  One of them is an adult and the other, 11, is in school and still lives with her.  Her husband earns a living fishing seasonally.

Zoila's a homemaker who, to earn her own income and be able to help her husband with the household expenses, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works three days a week from two to three hours a day.  She leaves her products on credit and collects every week.  She has worked in this business for more than six years and it's going very well for her.  What she sells most is perfume and cosmetics because they're very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

She has been in the communal bank for more than 10 years and she likes the help they offer with the loans.  Her dream is to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 36 years old and she is married. She has two children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cigarettes, noodles, bread, water, eggs and hard and soft drinks. She is happy with TRM (Tuba RaiMetin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, bread, water, eggs and soft and hard drinks

loans.name: Gilson Fernando

texts.es: Gilson, a sus 30 años de edad es padre de 1 hijo de 7 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias y su vida productiva la ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos para la venta, pero por cuestiones externas de violencia, decidió trasladarse con su familia hacia la ciudad, en busca de mejores oportunidades para mejorar el nivel de vida, pero, lastimosamente no fue la mejor decisión y por falta de oportunidades laborales, le fue difícil emplearse, por que retornó a su pueblo natal con su familia. Allí comenzó nuevamente su actividad y la desarrolla desde su casa, con lo cual ha podido generar ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas en su hogar. El titular solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito como apoyo para la compra de 1 marrana y lechones (cría de cerdos) para engordarlos y venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado, con lo cual podrá mejorar los ingresos familiares y tener una estabilidad económica. Esto le permitirá a Gilson tener su negocio bien establecido, permanecer en su vereda y obtener los recursos necesarios para darle una excelente educación a su hijo y brindar la oportunidad a su familia de mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Gilson is 30 years old.  He is the father of a seven year old son and lives in a common-law relationship with his partner.  He was born and raised in the country, where he learned agricultural work and he has dedicated all his life to breeding pigs for sale.  But because of external issues of violence, he decided to move to the city with his family in search of better opportunities to improve their standard of living.  However, unfortunately, it was not the best decision and there were no job opportunities.  It was difficult for him to find employment, so he returned to his hometown with his family.  There, he began his activity again and developed his business from home, which enabled him to generate income to meet his basic household needs.
