Sr. Cesar is 31 years old and married to Sra. Maritza Elizabeth. They have a five-year-old daughter who is in preschool. Sr. Cesar has been working for two years as a manager at a furniture store while Sra. Maritza Elizabeth takes care of their daughter.

Their home lacks the finishing touches to the exterior, so they are requesting a loan since they do not have the money needed to make this improvement. They will also pay someone to complete the work.

Part of Sr. Cesar’s salary will be used to repay the loan since his job is the only source of income that they have.

loans.use: to finish the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es: Doña Rafaela es habitante del barrio Memorial Sandino, una zona marginal de Managua, ella ha sido madre soltera, sola siempre busca la manera de cómo salir adelante, hoy en día solamente tiene a una hija bajo su cargo quien está estudiando y la apoya mediante la venta de ropa, la cual en la actualidad no tiene casi nada en su inventario ya que ha sufrido problemas de salud y tuvo que ocupar los ingresos de las ventas. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en su negocio comprando dos pacas y el resto en cosméticos, con esta inversión doña Rafaela espera recuperarse económicamente para garantizar los pagos diarios del hogar.
texts.en: Rafaela lives in Memorial Sandino, a low-income area of Managua. She has been a single mother and always sought to get ahead. She now cares for one daughter, who studies and helps her sell clothing. Rafaela has very little inventory because she was ill and had to use her earnings to pay bills. She has applied for a loan to buy two bags of bulk clothing and cosmetics. Rafaela hopes the loan will help her recover financially and pay her daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bags of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tomas Pascual

texts.es:
Tomas tiene 62 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Tomas se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz.Con el apoyo del credito puede tener mas productos.

Solicita el crédito para poder tener capital para la agricultura para la comprar de semillas y fertilizantes, Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a tener un beneficio para la familia.

El sueño es darle mejor vida a la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ir a rio.
texts.en:
Tomas, 62, lives in a free union and has five children. He lives with his spouse and children in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. The communal bank Luchando Juntos (Striving Together) is located in Zapotal Nuevo in Ventanas canton. Most of the members are merchants.

Tomas grows corn and rice. He has applied for the loan to buy farm supplies, seed and fertilizer. The loan will benefit his family, and he dreams of giving them a better life. He likes to go to the river in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Geruncia

texts.en:
Geruncia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling medicine. Geruncia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

Geruncia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Neptali

texts.es: Neptali, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Morazán Yoro, junto a su esposa y una hija. El se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, y tiene más de 4 años de haber comenzado a realizar otras actividades para generar más ingresos al hogar. El compra cerdos y los destaza para vender la carne y también vende refrescos, y topogigios (helados). Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por 4,000 Lempiras para comprar frutas para elaborar jugos naturales y compra de refrescos de botella para la venta. Con esta otra inversión podrá seguir trabajando para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su plan es crecer con el negocio y darle lo mejor a su esposa e hija.
texts.en:
Neptali, 28, lives in the city of Morazán Yoro with his wife and daughter. He is a farmer, but, for over four years, he has engaged in other activities to generate more income for his household. He buys and raises pigs to sell for meat and also sell beverages and ice cream.

He has applied for a loan of 4,000 lempiras to buy fruit to make natural juices and to buy bottled beverages to sell. The loan will let him continue to work to support his family. He plans to grow his business and give his wife and daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make natural juices and to buy bottled beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lotions, talc powder, lipstick, body spray, blush, and facial cream to sell

loans.name: Lyndelou

texts.en:
Lyndelou is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She earns additional income from clothing sales and manicures. Lyndelou is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lyndelou has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar  tiene 38 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Él  ha pasado momentos muy difíciles; su padre los abandono cuando estaba muy pequeño, obligando así  a su mama a tener que hacerse cargo de llevar el sustento para su familia, teniendo ella que emigrar  a trabajar en la capital como costurera, dejando a Oscar y sus hermanos con los abuelos.

Pero Oscar fue aprendiendo  a trabajar la tierra con sus abuelos y a podido ir pasando la vida.  Cuando ya formo su propia familia ha podido ir construyendo su propia casita, con su trabajo en la milpa y trabajando en los cañales  que hay en la zona. Solo estudio hasta  el quinto año de estudio de educación básica, con ello ha podido entenderle a la albañilería, cuando hay oportunidades él trabaja en esto.

Compra los materiales e insumos en una comunidad que esta  a 3 kilómetros de su casa, trasladando los en su carreta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para terminar de construir su casa, ya que le falta ponerle ventanas debido a que en invierno azota el agua. Desea estar tranquilo con su familia en su casa en la época de invierno, ademas podrá tener sus pertenencias totalmente seguras, ya que la situación de inseguridad en el país esta  creciendo.

Oscar sueña con tener  finalizada su casa y seguir trabajando la tierra y si es posible adquirir un par de vacas para tener  leche y subproductos de esta, para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 38, lives with his partner and has two children. He has seen some difficult times. His father abandoned the family when Oscar was very young. His mother had to provide for the family by going to the capital to work as a seamstress and leaving Oscar and his siblings with his grandparents. Oscar learned to work the land with his grandparents and get on with his life.

When he started his family, he began building a house with money from his work in the fields and local canals. He only completed fifth grade, but the education helped him understand bricklaying, and he does this work when it is available. He buys materials and supplies in a town three kilometers from his house and transports them in his cart.

He has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to finish building his house, which still needs windows to keep out the water in winter and keep his belongings safe, as lack of security is a growing problem in the country. Oscar dreams of finishing his house and continuing to work the land. He would like to buy a pair of cows to produce milk and milk products for his children.

loans.use: to finish building his house, which still needs windows to keep out the water in winter.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old, married and has three children. 

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Robina has an egg retailing business in the Philippines. Robina requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Robina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Robina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Yorlenis

texts.es: Yorlenis, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de su suegra. Yorlenis se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y esta actitud sumada a su buena sazón le ha permitido obtener muy buena acogida y demanda por los clientes de su barrio. Realiza este negocio desde hace 6 meses con la ayuda de su suegra. Le gusta su negocio pues comenta que le agrada cocinar gracias a las enseñanzas que le brindó su madre, del mismo modo también le agrada el ingreso económico que obtiene por sus ventas los cuales le han permitido pagar sus cuentas y ayudar a solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Al contrario no le gusta levantarse muy temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajando con mayor optimismo hasta culminar el día. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, comenta sentirse agradecida con el apoyo financiero que le brindarán para continuar desarrollando su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de sus comidad como carnes, plátanos, aceite, condimentos, arroz, entre otros.
texts.en:
Yorlenis is a 24-year old woman who is married and has two children. They all live in her mother-in-law's house and she works selling regional dishes. She is very kind to her clients and very mature, which have resulted in a good reception and demand from her neighbors. She has been running this business with her mother-in-law's help for six months, and enjoys cooking the way her mother taught her. The income she obtains serves to pay the bills and cover basic household expenses. Although she does not enjoy getting up early to get ready for the day, she keeps up her optimism and enthusiasm. 

She is requesting 500 PEN and says she feels grateful for the financial support provided. She will use this amount to progressively buy the ingredients she needs, such as meat, bananas, oil, spices and rice, among others. She commits to repaying the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy food products, such as meat, bananas, oil, spices and rice, among others.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita, de 39 años de edad, está casada con Francisco y juntos tienen 3 hijos de 18, 5 y 3 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Melita se dedica a la fabricación de palitos de helado. Semanalmente acude a su vivienda un señor quien le trae los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de estos productos como triplay, pinturas y otros. La elaboración de los palitos se hace uno por uno de manera manual, los que son usados para los helados, sin embargo hay otros de mayor medida que son pintados para darles usos didácticos o decorativos. Cuando tiene la cantidad requerida envía sus productos en sacos a otras ciudades y por ello recibe un buen pago. Lleva trabajando en este negocio 2 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana. Eventualmente, vende productos comestibles y bebidas las cuales envía a los centros poblados asentados en la ribera de los ríos. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos familiares, se siente feliz porque su negocio está creciendo a base de mucho esfuerzo ya que siempre está pensando en brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará los materiales necesarios como triplay, cuchillas y pinturas para continuar elaborando los palitos de helados.
texts.en:
Melita is a 39-year old woman who is married to Francisco and has three children, aged 18, 5 and 3 years old. They all live together in their own house. Melita works making ice cream sticks and her supplier brings weekly the materials she needs, such as laminated wood, paint and others. She makes the sticks to be used for ice cream manually one by one. Others are painted for decorative and educational purposes. When she has a certain amount of sticks, she sends them in bags to other cities and receives the corresponding payment. She has been working in this business for two years and counts on her sister's help. Sometimes she also sells food products and beverages that are sent to localities by the river shores. She likes her business as it allows her to have income to cover household expenses and feels happy to see it grow thanks to her hard work. 

She is requesting 1,500 PEN and feels grateful for the financial support received. She will use this amount to buy the necessary materials, such as laminated wood, blades and paint, and commits to repaying as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy laminated wood, blades and paint.

loans.name: Sugerin Yuliana

texts.es: Sugerin, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Anteriormente trabajaba en un supermercado y hace 5 años se decidió por su propio negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos como desodorantes, cremas, y otros productos de limpieza. Dicha actividad es su fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia. El préstamo que solicito es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y es por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como ropa y cosméticos. Su plan es satisfacer a sus clientes ofreciendo mas producto y poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sugerin is 30 years old and is a single mother who lives with her parents and two children in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. She used to work in a supermarket but decided to start her own business five years ago selling clothing, footwear and cosmetics including deodorant and lotions, and cleaning products. This economic activity brings in income to cover her family's expenses.

The loan that she is now requesting is her third with ODEF and is for 8,000 lempiras. She will use it to buy merchandise for her business including clothing and cosmetics. Her plan is to satisfy her customers by offering more products. She also plans to be able to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business including clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 42 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Chona has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Chona has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Consuelo Maritza

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 47 años de edad vive en Union libre tiene 7 hijos vive con el compañero y con  los hijos viven en la cuidad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla el laurel se encuentras ubicada en el recinto el laurel de la parroquia zapotal nuevo perteneciente al cantón ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas

Consuelo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz , con crédito le ayudado a invertir en semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes para los cultivos.  El crédito es de gran ayuda para aumentar la producción.

El sueño es incremenar la produccion y el negocio.

Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte y hacer los quehaceres doesticos
texts.en:
Consuelo is 47 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has seven children. She lives with her partner and children. They live in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

The El Laurel communal bank is located in the El Laurel rural settlement in the Zapotal Nuevo parish, which is part of the Ventanas canton. It focuses on agricultural work.

Consuelo works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. This loan has helped her purchase seeds, manure, and fertilizer for her crops. The loan is of great help to increase production.

Consuelo's dream is to increase production and business. She likes working, playing sports, and doing housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Wendy Johanna

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín.  Aprendió computación en los cursos del colegio, por lo cual decidió establecer este negocio de bazar/papelería donde también realiza impresiones a computadora y copias.  Labora sola de 8 am a 10 pm.  Es casada, su esposo es policía y tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 asisten a la escuela fiscal de la zona.  Su sueño es poder montar un negocio más grande, con un cyber completo.  Desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de artículos de papelería (cuadernos, láminas y fomix) para su negocio.
texts.en: Wendy Johanna is from the Fortin neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She learned how to use computers in college courses she took, and so she decided to establish this general/stationery store business where she also makes computer print-outs and copies.  She works alone from 8am until 10pm.  She is married, and her husband is a policeman.  They have 4 children, 3 of whom attend the local public school.  Wendy's dream is to be able to have a bigger business with a full internet cafe.  She wants a loan to buy stationery items (notebooks, laminated sheets, and sheets of craft foam) for her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, laminated sheets, and sheets of craft foam

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora María tiene cuarenta y cuatro (44) años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande, pueblo ribereño, del departamento del Atlántico, a orillas del Gran Río Magdalena, principal arteria fluvial de Colombia. Reside con su conyugue y cuatro (4) hijos, tres (3) varones en edades de dieciocho (18), veintidós (22) y veinticuatro (24) años de edad, y una mujer de veintiséis (26) años. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la comercialización de mercancía variada como calzado y ropa de jeans para hombres y mujeres y blusas femeninas. De lunes a domingo, de ocho (8) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche, ejerce su actividad de negocio, comprando de contado en el mercado del centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, capital del departamento del Atlántico, y vende a vecinos, familiares y amigos, a crédito. Desde hace tres (3) años inició esta actividad por la necesidad de buscar otra fuente de ingresos para su familia, comenzó con un capital pequeño la venta de calzado, y luego incluyo la venta de ropa. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de ropa y calzado para hombres y mujeres, con esta inversión aumentará sus inventarios. Sueña con tener su local propio, y espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 44-year old woman who lives in the municipality of Sabanagrande, a village by the shore of Gran Río Magdalena (main river in Colombia), in the department of Atlántico. She lives with her husband and their four children: three boys aged 18, 22 and 24, and one girl who is 26 years old. She works selling shoes, women blouses and clothes for men and women, Monday through Sunday from 8am to 8pm. She buys in cash in the market located downtown Barranquilla (capital of the department of Atlántico) and sells on credit to neighbors, family and friends. She started the business three years ago with an aim to find an additional income source for her family. She started with a small capital selling shoes and then added the clothing sale. 

This is her first loan with Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the requested amount to buy clothes and shoes for men and women, so that she can increase her stock. She dreams of having her own store and hopes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Pablo Cesar

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con la tia en la cuidad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla el laurel se encuentras ubicada en el recinto el laurel de la parroquia zapotal nuevo perteneciente al cantón ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas

Pablo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz con crédito le ayudado a invertir en semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes para los cultivos.  El crédito es de gran ayuda para aumentar la producción.

El sueño es tener mas ingresos economicos con los cuales al ahorrar podria hacer la casa y seguir con el negocio.

Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte y ayudar a la tia.
texts.en:
Pablo is 19 years old, unmarried and does not have children. He lives with his aunt in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

The "El Laurel" Communal Bank is found located in the El Laurel recinto in the Zapotal Nuevo parish of the Ventanas canton, where agricultural activities are carried out. 

Pablo makes a living within agriculture planting corn. With loans he has been able to invest in seeds, manure and fertilizers for his crops. The loans are a great help to increase production. 

His dream is to have greater earnings with which he will be able to save in order to build his house and continue with the business. He enjoys working, playing sports and supporting his aunt.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains for trading business

loans.name: Guilda Germania

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Aprendió años atrás del negocio mediante cursos públicos de arte.  Se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y manualidades artísticas.  Labora sola de 8 am a 4 pm.  Es casada, su esposo es chofer y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del barrio.  Desea en un futuro poder tener su local propio con más mercadería de la que produce actualmente.  Necesita invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de masilla, colores y pinceles para la creación de sus productos.
texts.en: This client is from the Fortín sector in Guayaquil.   She learned her business years ago by taking public art courses.  She works making arts and crafts.  She works alone from 8am until 4pm.  She’s married and her husband is a driver; she has three children attending the local public school.  She hopes in future to be able to have a shop of her own with more merchandise than what she produces currently.  She needs to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of modeling clay, paints and brushes for the creation of her products.

loans.use: to buy modeling clay, brushes and paints.

loans.name: Guadalupe Lucía

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Comenzó a vender la línea Yanbal hace 9 años y luego diversificó con las líneas de Avon y Essika.  Labora todos los días, con un horario de acuerdo a la realización de los pedidos de sus clientes.  Está en estado de unión libre, tiene un hijo de 7 años que estudia en la escuela fiscal del sitio.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para realizar la compra de artículos de belleza como lociones, perfumes y cremas de las líneas que comercializa.
texts.en: Guadalupe Lucia lives in the Fortin neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She started selling Yanbal beauty products 9 years ago, and later diversified into other brands such as Avon and Essika.  She works every day, and her schedule depends on the orders that her customers make.  She is in a common-law marriage that has produced a 7 year-old child who attends the local public school.  Guadalupe needs a loan at this time so that she can buy beauty products such as lotions, perfumes, and creams in the brand that she works with.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal brand beauty products

loans.name: Daniel Edgardo

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura desde los 12 años de edad, aprendió a trabajar la tierra con su padre y sus 6 hermanos. Además de sembrar maíz y frijol, se dedica a cultivar maicillo para obtener grano para alimentar sus gallinas, también el zacate de este lo aprovecha para alimentar su vaquita.

Don Daniel busca como llevar ingresos a su familia, en varias ocasiones trabaja como jornalero donde le pagan $5 dolares por día de trabajo. Los insumos y materiales los adquiere en una ciudad que se encuentra a 10 kilómetros de distancia a su casa, los transporta en bus para ahorrar un poco.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar 2 terneros para engordarlos y luego venderlos, obteniendo un pequeño ingreso en el futuro. Tener el dinero para aprovechar la época (lluviosa) donde hay abundancia de pasto para alimentar el ganado.

Él quiere tener varios formas de ingreso para mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia, trabajando honradamente.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 45-year old man who is married and has two children. He started working in agriculture when he was 12 and learned how to work in the land with his father and his six brothers. He sows corn and beans and also cultivates sorghum to obtain grain for the hens and forage for his cow. 

Daniel looks to bring income to his family and sometimes works as a day laborer for $5 per day. He buys the necessary supplies and materials in a city located 10km away from his home and brings them by bus to save some money. 

He is requesting a loan to buy two calfs to feed them and then sell them, obtaining some profit in the future. He would make the most of the rainy season when there is plenty of grass to feed the livestock. He wants to have several income sources to improve the life conditions of his family by working honorably.

loans.use: to buy two calfs to feed them and sell them.

loans.name: Nuvia Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Nuvia tiene cuarenta y cinco (45) años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande, departamento del Atlántico, pueblo ubicado a orillas del gran Río Magdalena, principal arteria fluvial de Colombia. Reside con su conyugue y dos hijos, una jovencita de catorce (14) años de edad, y un varon de doce (12) años. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la comercialización de perfumes; ejerce este oficio de lunes a domingo, de ocho (8) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche, vende a vecinos, amigos y familiares, a plazos cortos y medianos, y compra de contado a los proveedores. Este negocio lo inició hace dos (2) años, cuando su esposo viajaba a Estados Unidos y le mandaba perfumes para que ella los comercializara; de esta manera se fue haciendo a una clientela. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de mas fragancias de perfumes, para ofrecerla a sus clientes y poder satisfacer su buen gusto. Con esta inversión aumentará su capital de trabajo, las ventas y su claidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nuvia is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of Sabanagrande in the department of Atlántico, located on the banks of the grand Río Magdalena which is the primary water source of Colombia. She lives with her partner and two children: a young 14 year old girl and a 12 year old boy. Her business consists of selling perfumes, which she does Monday through Sunday from 8am until 8pm. She sells to her neighbors, friends and acquaintances with short and medium term payment plans. 

She began this business two years ago when her husband traveled to the US and sent her perfumes to sell. In this way she began establishing her client base. This is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy more perfumes to offer to her clients and satisfy their tastes. With this investment, she will increase her working capital, sales and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes for her customers.

loans.name: Afripads

texts.en:
In 2009, a unique company called AFRIpads was established in Uganda. Set up to help girls and women deal with their period in a dignified, affordable way, the company was distinctive in that it manufactures reusable sanitary pads in Uganda rather than importing them.  

Currently, AFRIpads employs over 40 local Ugandan women from rural areas who are pivotal both in the manufacturing process, and ultimately responding to the needs of girls who could not afford sanitary pads and were missing school during their periods. 

These women live in a small village called Kitengeesa about 3 hours’ drive from Kampala, which is off-grid with only basic facilities. With no access to power, they risk respiratory problems, fires and burns by depending on kerosene lamps for lighting in their homes and have to pay for their mobile phones to be charged which is a high cost luxury for them given the limited power supply.

AFRIpads approached Fenix International, a renewable energy company, to help provide their employees with access to clean, safe and affordable lighting plus empower them to generate additional income from phone charging. Fenix designs and manufacturers the ReadySet Solar Charger, a high quality, easy to use solar system that comes with a 15watt solar panel and provides up to 30 hours of lighting or charge up to 10 phones a day. The ReadySet allows a household to generate income of up to $50 per month by charging phones and generating savings by removing the need to purchase kerosene. They ReadySet is also capable of providing reliable energy to power other devices such as radios and hair clippers. 

Gorreth, an AFRIpad employee (pictured with her light and also shown with her fellow employees), has been testing the ReadySet Solar Charger in her small shop in the village, which she runs next to her AFRIpads job. With the new light, she has been able to keep her shop open for longer in the evening, helping her sell even more products plus she now makes additional income from offering phone charging to the village community for a small fee. She lives in her shop as well and having a light will make her life safer, so much so, she wants to buy one for her parents as well. 

Thanks to Kiva, Fenix will be able to supply their ReadySet Solar Charger on loan to AFRIpads’ employees, who can pay on affordable monthly installments over a year-long period. Payments are deducted directly from their pay slips each month, leaving them with profits and savings generated from the ReadySet Solar Charger to help improve their lives.

loans.use: To access clean, reliable, solar energy for AFRIpad employees

loans.name: Cornerstone

texts.en:
Teachers and workers at the Cornerstone organization in Uganda have dedicated themselves to giving under privileged youths the opportunity to turn their lives around, providing them with skills and capabilities they need to participate in society as independent, mature, and responsible individuals.

Employees at Cornerstone such as Peninah, a 29 year old and a single mother of one child, earns $120 a month and is able to take care of her child and obtain basic needs for home.  Whilst the school is connected the mains power, it can be unstable with regular blackouts that can last for days. Living in the staff quarter’s means she is highly dependent on kerosene lamps for lighting and this means exposing herself and her child to the risk of dangerous fumes, not to mention burns and fires associated with their use. Many other teachers are in a similar position and the need for both reliable lighting and power can be life changing. 

Cornerstone approached Fenix International, a renewable energy company, to help provide their employees with access to clean, safe and affordable lighting plus empower them to generate additional income from phone charging. Fenix designs and manufacturers the ReadySet Solar Charger, a high quality, easy to use solar system that comes with a 15watt solar panel and provides up to 30 hours of lighting or charge up to 10 phones a day. The ReadySet allows a household to generate income of up to $50 per month by charging phones and generating savings by removing the need to purchase kerosene. They ReadySet is also capable of providing reliable energy to power other devices such as radios and hair clippers.

Thanks to Kiva, Fenix will be able to supply their ReadySet Solar Charger on loan to over 48 Cornerstone teachers and staff (pictured), who can pay on affordable monthly installments over a year-long period. Payments are deducted directly from their pay slips each month, leaving them with profits and savings generated from the ReadySet Solar Charger to help improve their lives.

loans.use: Clean, renewable solar energy products for teachers at Cornerstone

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina, tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una aldea del municipio  Morazán, Yoro. Anteriormente apoyaba a su esposo en la agricultura y hace 8 años decidió hacer su propio negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada como camisas, pantalones, blusas y ropa interior. Ha obtenido varios préstamos con ODEF para mantener activo su negocio. Actualmente solicita el decimo ciclo por la cantidad de 4,000 lempiras para comprar mercadería como camisas y pantalones para vender. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo con el negocio y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina is a 28-year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a village of the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. After having helped her husband in agriculture for some time, she decided to start her own business 8 years ago. She sells new and used clothes, such as shirts, pants, blouses and underwear. 

She has received several loans through ODEF to keep her business active and is now requesting her tenth cycle for 4,000 HNL. She will use this amount to buy goods, such as shirts and pants. Her goal is to grown the business and provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy goods, such as shirts and pants for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz Adriana es de estado civil casada, de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, se dedica a vender en su tienda de productos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tiendita y hasta el momento lleva 12 años de larga experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la sastreria.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para surtir más su tienda ya que ha tenido mucha demanda, comprará productos lacteos, huevos, aceite, cerales, azucar, etc. desea en el futuro tener una tienda grande y brindarle el mejor servicio a su comunidad. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agrícolas y crienza de animales. En la fotografia aparecen 17 integrantes pero solo a 13 de ellas se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Beatriz Adriana is a 54-year old woman who is married and has four children, one of whom is studying. She did not have the opportunity to study herself and works selling everyday basic products at her store. She started this business 12 years ago and has a lot of experience. She counts with the support of her husband, who works in tailoring. 

She has put together a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to buy supplies for the store following a high demand. She will buy dairy products, eggs, oil, cereals, sugar, etc. She hopes to have a big store in the future and to provide the community with a better service. The other members of the group work in agriculture and livestock. Only 13 members of the 17 shown in the photo were granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy everyday basic products.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is married and he works hard to support his family. He has a 'tricycle' transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. April is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for his tricycle.

April has been sustaining his business activities through his past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. April hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream: to save enough to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for his 'tricycle'.

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Fortín.  La necesidad la llevó a desempeñarse en esta actividad y además recibió el consejo y apoyo de sus vecinos.  Trabaja solo en su negocio, básicamente en el horario de la tarde.  No es casado pero tiene 2 hijos que van a la escuela fiscal.  A futuro tiene el deseo de comprarse un vehículo.  Ahora necesita el crédito para abastecerse con cortes de tela para su negocio.
texts.en: The client lives in the Fortín sector.  Need led her to go into this activity and she also got advice and support from her neighbors.  She works alone in her business usually in the afternoon schedule.  She’s unmarried but has two children attending public school.  In future she’d like to buy a vehicle.  She needs the loan now to stock up on pieces of fabric for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Malindi, Kenya.  She is widowed. Mary has four children who depend on her for upkeep; three of them attend school. For more than two years now she has been selling fish at the local market. This is what has been keeping the family. The business has been doing great and she recently started paying for the plot of land she intends to buy. She wants to build her own residential house in the next five years. 

The challenge in the business is customers not paying on time. She heard about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy 100 kgs of lake fish. The income from the business will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy 100 kgs of lake fish.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es: La cliente reside en la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Elaboraba empanadas para los vecinos, pero luego sus ventas se fueron incrementando hasta que llegó también a distribuír en otros lados.  Trabaja en las tardes con sus hijas.  Es soltero y a futuro desea comprarse un vehículo que le ayude en las labores diarias.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de harina y pollo para la elaboración de las empanadas que comercializa a diario.
texts.en: This client lives in the Fortín zone in Guayaquil.  She used to make turnovers for the neighbors but as her sales grew she started to also distribute them in other places.  She works evenings with her daughters.  She’s single and in future would like to buy a car to help with her daily chores.  She wants to use the loan to buy flour and chicken to make the turnovers she sells daily.

loans.use: to buy flour and chicken.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: La señora Ruth tiene cuarenta y siete (47) años de edad, vive en el caluroso municipio de Sabanagrande, pueblo ribereño, del departamento del Atlántico, a orillas del Gran Río Magdalena, principal arteria fluvial de Colombia. Reside con su conyugue y tres (3) hijos, dos (2) varones de veinticuatro (24) y veintisiete (27) años de edad, y una joven de veintiun (21) años. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la venta de carnes de res, gaseosas y minutos de celulares. Inició este negocio desde hace diez (10) años, a partir de la iniciativa de su esposo, quien trabajaba en un matadero y le traía carnes para que ella las vendiera. Estas actividades comerciales las ejerce de lunes a domingo, de siete (7) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche, compra a los proveedores de contado, y vende a vecinos, amigos y familiares de contado y a crédito. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de carnes, y gaseosas, para atender a su selecta clientela. Con estas inversiones espera mejorar su calidad de vida, y en un futuro cercano adecuar bien su local.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 47-year old woman who lives in the warm municipality of Sabanagrande, a village by the shore of Gran Río Magdalena (main river in Colombia), in the department of Atlántico. She lives with her husband and their three children: two boys aged 24 and 27, and one girl who is 21 years old. She works selling beef meat, sodas and phone calls by minutes. She started this business 10 years ago, thanks to her husband's initiative, who works in a slaughterhouse and brought meat for her to sell. She works Monday through Sunday from 7am to 8pm, buying in cash and selling on credit or in cash to neighbors, family and friends. 

This is her first loan with Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the requested amount to buy meat and soda to serve her selected clientele. She hopes to improve her quality of life and to make improvements her store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy meat and soda to serve her selected clientele.

loans.name: Rolando Santiago

texts.es: El cliente es de la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás por recomendación de sus vecinos, quienes tenían la necesidad de tener una tienda en el área.  Trabaja todo el día en compañía de su esposa, con quien tiene un hijo pequeño.  Tiene el ideal de poder completar la construcción de su vivienda.  Ahora necesita el crédito para comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceite.
texts.en: This client is from the Fortín zone in Guayaquil.  He started some time ago on recommendation of his neighbors who needed to have a store in the area.  He works all day in company of his wife with whom he has a little son.  His hope is to be able to finish building his house.  He needs the loan now to buy food items like rice, sugar and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Angela Paola

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Hace 4 años tuvo la posibilidad de montar este negocio y le gustó mucho, tanto que ahora cuenta con una buena acogida en el lugar.  Trabaja solo, mayormente en el horario de la tarde.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Aspira en un futuro poder instalar un cyber y prosperar con ese negocio también.  Actualmente necesita el préstamo para la compra de material: cartulinas, lápices y cuadernos.
texts.en: This client is from the Fortín sector in Guayaquil.  She was able to set up this business four years ago and liked it very much, so much so that today it’s very well-received in the area.  She works alone mostly during the afternoon shift.  She’s single and has no children.  In future she’d like to open an Internet café and to make progress with that business too.  She currently needs the loan to buy supplies: construction paper, pencils and notebooks.

loans.use: to buy construction paper, notebooks and pencils.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children.  She is running a business in front of her house, selling slippers, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, Coca-Cola, etc. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she makes sales every day. 

Carlota has been running her business since 2005 with her own working capital. Her husband is a farmer. She is happy with this loan because TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people to improve their  businesses and then their living conditions for the future. Carlota lives in a house that is very simple, and she has many animals  like pigs, goats, sheep and chickens.

loans.use: To buy slippers, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, 'sagiko', beer, cigarettes, water and bread.

loans.name: Joe-Ann

texts.en:
Joe-Ann dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman. She runs a grocery business in their village. Joe-Ann started with a small 'sari-sari' store. While running her store, Joe-Ann has learned from her experiences. She used those experiences to continuously improve her 'sari-sari' store, finally improving it into a grocery store.

Joe-Ann's husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker. The couple is blessed with one child who is currently in preschool. Joe-Ann hopes that someday her husband will no longer work abroad thus she is working hard to develop her business and generate more income. 

With that in mind, she desires to access a loan of P50,000 to buy various items like soft drinks, canned goods, fruit and vegetables to sell. She is looking forward to KIVA lenders approving her loan request for it will help her attain her dreams, not only for the business but for her family as well.

loans.use: to buy various items like drinks, canned goods, fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina runs a car hire business in Malindi, Kenya where she also lives. She is married with three children who attend school. Her business has been doing great. This is the only business that the family depends on for a living. 

Sabina has been in the car hire business for the last three years. She heard about Milango through friends at a time when she wanted funding for the business. She now seeks a loan to buy spare parts for the cars. She has a long-term ambition of adding a fleet of vehicles and running a successful car hire business. The challenge that she faces is when customers damage the vehicles and they don’t pay for the damage. Income from the business will improve her living standards and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Fátima Antonia

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos.  Tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, crianza de ganado de repasto  ya que toda su vida se a dedicado a dichas actividad, las que aprendió de sus padres. Hoy las realiza por su propia cuenta junto a su compañero de vida con el cual ya tiene 6 años de estar juntos y han procreado 2 hijos por los cuales seguirán luchando hasta sacarlos adelante

 Viaja unos 1.5 kilómetros  a pie hasta donde toma un autobús o pick up  en el que se tarda unos 25 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad en donde compra los insumos para su cultivo de maíz; luego se regresa pagando un pick up para llevar los insumos para su casa.

El crédito sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, pesticidas, para cultivar maíz y para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar. 

Gracias al préstamo podrá darle un mejor beneficio a sus cultivos de los  cuales espera tener mejor producción y teniendo mejor producción podrá tener mejores ingresos económicos para su familia y saldar su deuda.

Su plan es construir una vivienda digna en donde pueda vivir con sus 2 hijos y su compañero  de vida.
texts.en:
Fátima is a 26-year old young woman who lives with her partner and has two children. She has a lot of experience in the cultivation of corn and livestock breeding as she has always worked in these activities. She learned them from her parents and today works on her own with her partner. They have been together for six years and have two children, for whom they fight. She walks 1.5km to pick up the bus that takes her to the city in 25 minutes. This is where she buys the inputs to cultivate the corn. 

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to cultivate corn and to cover household expenses. Thanks to this financial support, she will be able to improve the crops and therefore expects to have a better harvest and higher income for her family and to repay the loan. Her plan is to build a decent house to live with her partner and two children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to cultivate corn and to cover household expenses.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Doña María, tiene a sus hijos grandes y están estudiando en colegios públicos, ella continua dedicándose a su pequeña pulpería mientras su esposo sale a las calles a taxear de esta manera buscan el pan de cada día. María solicita el crédito para invertir en la pulpería comprando productos como granos básicos, queso, carbón, gaseosas, lo que le garanticen vender diario para mantener sus gastos del hogar.
texts.en: María has six grown-up children who attend public schools. She works in her small grocery store while her husband makes a living with his taxi. María is requesting a loan to invest in her store and buy basic grains, cheese, charcoal and sodas, which will guarantee daily sales to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cheese, charcoal and sodas.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita has been in the tailoring business for 30 years. She is married with four children. At present, two of her children are working while another one is married and the youngest is still studying. Avelita aims to become a successful entrepreneur someday although she is already at retirement age, so she is doing her best.

Avelita would like to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used in buying cloth and accessories for her tailoring business, specifically for curtains. She hopes for the approval of her requested loan amount for this will greatly help her improve the business she has been with for so long.

loans.use: to buy cloth and accessories for her tailoring business, specifically for curtains.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, que se esfuerza cada día por brindar a su familia lo mejor. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años; oficio que aprendió de sus  padres. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposo que se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y cuidarlas; mientras ella se  prepara para ir a  vender frutas y verduras a la ciudad y en la tarde se dirige a la  parcela donde cultivan junto a su esposo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  el abono, la semilla, herbicidas, pago de maquinaria y mano de obra para arar la tierra en donde cultivara. Con la producción de la cosecha, obtendrá buenos ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Ella desea en un futuro construir su vivienda; ya que actualmente esta construida de lamina.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 38-year old woman who is married and has four children. She is a hard-working woman who fights every day to provide her family with the best. She works in agriculture, an activity that she learned from her parents. She gets up at 5am and, while her husband takes care of the cows and milks them, she get ready to go downtown to sell fruits and vegetables. In the afternoon she goes to the piece of land where she and her husband cultivate. 

She is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, machinery and labor to work in the land. They expect to obtain good income from the harvest to support the family. Her goal is to build a house in the future, given that their current one is made of layers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, machinery and labor to work in the land where she will cultivate.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 34 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juana se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, entre otros. Todos estos productos los envía a los caseríos ubicados en las riberas de los ríos y zonas alejadas de la ciudad. Su hermano recibe toda la mercadería y lo vende a los pobladores del lugar. Se inició hace más de 2 años. Cuando no está de viaje, se dedica a la venta de comidas por las noches en el frontis de su casa. Considera rentable sus negocios  por los  ingresos económicos que le generan, los cuales usa para pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Antes de iniciarse con ésta actividad sus ingresos económicos no le alcanzaban para solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está obteniendo, tiene planes de aumentar el volumen de sus compras. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería variada como arroz, azúcar,leche, fideos, harina, entre otros para venderlos por el río, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, is married and the mother of three children with whom she lives in her own house.

Juana earns a living selling food products such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, and others.  She sends all these products to the hamlets located on the banks of the rivers and areas far from the city.  Her brother receives all the merchandise and sells it to residents of the area.  She started more than two years ago.  When she's not traveling she sells food at night in front of her house.

She considers her businesses profitable for the income they generate for her, which she uses to cover the household expenses and her children's education.  Her income wasn't enough to pay for her children's necessities before starting with this job.  Now, seeing the good results she's getting, she plans to increase the volume of her purchases.

Currently she'll request 2000 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to receive some financial support so she can get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy a variety of merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, flour, and other products to sell by the river, trying to get lower prices for her cash purchases.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, pasta, flour, and other merchandise

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en:
Sari Indah Badung group is getting their new loan from MUK. With 10 members, the total loan is 25,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair cages. 

Ni Nyoman, the head of the group, is using her share of the loan to buy three piglets, pig feed, and to repair the cage. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Ni Nyoman expects during the loan period the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: To buy three piglets, pig feed, and to repair the cage

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Myrna has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from 'tricycle' transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, de 49 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gladis se dedica a la venta de comidas, todos los días al acercarse la noche instala en la vereda de su casa sus mesas y sillas en donde ofrece a la venta sus deliciosas comidas que son acompañadas con refrescantes bebidas preparados con frutas naturales. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años, Trabaja con ayuda de todos sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aparte de tener un tiempo disponible para otras funciones, también le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas, realiza su labor tranquilamente ya que gracias a ello tiene un respaldo económico que le permite enfrentar cualquier situación en la que requiera hacer uso de dinero, le gustaría mucho tener un restaurante en donde tenga más mesas, sillas y atender a muchas mas personas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como arroz, pollo, aceite, aceitunas y frutas, además de platos y otros utensilios que necesita para brindar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 49-year old woman who is married and has three children, with whom she lives in her own house. Gladis works selling food. Every night she takes out tables and chairs and offers her delicious dishes and refreshing beverages made with natural fruits. She has been doing this for three years now and counts with the help of her children. She enjoys her job because it gives her time for other tasks and provides her with good income and a financial backup to face unexpected situations. She would like to have a restaurant with more tables and chairs to serve more people. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN and is grateful for the financial support. She will use the requested amount to buy ingredients and inputs, such as rice, chicken, oil, olives and fruits, as well as plates and other utensils to better serve her clients. She commits to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies, such as rice, chicken, oil, olives and fruits, as well as plates and other utensils to provide clients with a better service.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old and widowed, with five children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more items, like snack foods, sardines, seasonings, and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Norma aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like snack foods, sardines, seasonings, and other groceries.

loans.name: Raphaeli

texts.en:
Raphaeli is 42 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. He runs a grocery store in town where he sells vegetables and fruits. He started this business three years ago and he has one employee. He sees his business growing in the next five years. The major challenges in the business include competition from other traders and bad debts. 

Raphaeli knew of Milango Financial Services through a friend and now he seeks a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. He has a plot of land that he plans to develop. The extra income he gets will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jose Denis

texts.es: José vive en el barrio El Recreo, una zona marginal de Managua, habita junto a su familia, su hijo quien aun no va a la escuela porque está pequeño, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y en los quehaceres del hogar en vista de que se le ha hecho difícil encontrar empleo, el siempre dedicado al negocio de venta de productos plásticos desechables en un mercado de Managua, su mayor deseo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio es por eso que solicita el crédito para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y salir adelante.
texts.en: José lives in El Recreo neighborhood, a marginal area in Managua. He lives with his family: his son, who is still young to attend school, and his wife, who helps in the business and takes care of the house as it has been difficult for her to find a job. He has always worked selling plastic products in the Managua market and his biggest dream is to continue investing in his business. He is requesting a loan to improve his income and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, such as cups, spoons and plates, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand the storehouses for pig breeding.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 55 years old and married, with six children.

Elenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sardines, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Elenita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Elenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 43 years old and single.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nemia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nemia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 54 years old and married, with 4 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Luzviminda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras San Rafael Soche Group

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Isaura de estado civil casada, cuenta con 31 años de edad, de escolaridad 6to. primaria tiene 2 hijos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cilindros de gas, inició este negocio con un capital de Q.200,000.00 y 15 cilindros de gas, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia. cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al servicio de mecánico de enderezado y pintura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mas cilindros de diferente tamaño, espera en el futuro que su negocio crezca y estar bien posicionado. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y venta de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Reyna Isaura, 31, is married and has two children, both of whom are attending school.  She completed the sixth grade of elementary school.

She makes a living buying and selling cylinders of gas, a business she started with 200,000 quetzales [GTC] in capital and 15 cylinders.  At present she has seven years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who works as a mechanic in a body and paint shop.

She's organizing a group and requesting a loan to buy more cylinders in various sizes.  She hopes her business will grow in the future.

The other members of the group earn their livings raising animals and selling daily necessity items.

loans.use: to buy gas

loans.name: Kijembe Group

texts.en:
Anton, who is in his early 30s, is married, with two children, a boy and a girl, who are in school. 

For three years now, Anton has been running a retail business, selling fruits and charcoal. He works from 6am to 8pm daily and he is able to make a very good profit per month. 

This will be Anton's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and fruits. With the profit received, he managed to buy a plot of land and he paid school fees and household expenses. Anton has successfully repaid all of his previous loans. He will use this loan to buy more local chickens to sell.  He dreams of building a nice family house. 

Anton will share this loan with his loan group, Kijembe Group, which includes 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more local chickens to sell.

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es:
José tiene 20 años de edad es casado con la esposa y con  los hijos viven en la cuidad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla el laurel se encuentras ubicada en el recinto el laurel de la parroquia zapotal nuevo perteneciente al cantón ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol además a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos, con crédito le ayudado a invertir en semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes para los cultivos y en balanceado para los animales.  El crédito es de gran ayuda para aumentar la producción.

El sueño es obtener ingresos económicos e irlos ahorrando ya que con ello puede seguir comprando lo necesario y así obtener la casa y la siembra

Le gusta hacer deporte, estudiar y pasar mas tiempo con mi familia.
texts.en:
José is a 20-year old married man who lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The "Laurel" communal bank is located in Recinto El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish belonging to the cantón Ventanas and is involved in agriculture. José cultivates corn, rice and beans, and also breeds hens and pigs.

Thanks to the loan, he has bought seeds and fertilizers for the crops and animal feed. The loan has been of great help to increase production. 

His dream is to increase his income and to save money, so that he can keep investing in his land and his house. He enjoys exercising, studying and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Julia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Julia tiene 22 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Julia se dedica desde a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y frejol.

Solicita el crédito para poder tener capital para la agricultura para la comprar de semillas y fertilizantes, Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a tener un beneficio para la familia.

El sueño es incremetar los cultivos y asi obtener mas ganancias del cultivo.
texts.en:
Julia is a 22-year old woman who lives with her partner and their son in the cantón Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank "Luchando Juntos" is located in the Recinto New Zapotal belonging to Ventanas cantón. The majority of its members work in retail. Julia works in agriculture and cultivates corn and beans. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to ultimately benefit her family. Her dream is to expand her crops and to obtain more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Indah Group receives their new loan with the same loan amount and the same members. The loan is still used for increasing their pig businesses. Besides purchasing piglets, they will also use the loan to renovate the cages and buy feed.

Ni Komang uses her loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. They will be sold five months later. Money for daily needs comes from her husband. Her husband is really happy for that. He supports his wife’s business by maintaining the pigs, feeding and washing the cage every afternoon. Ni Komang and her husband hope the business will be successful for both pigs and her husband's work.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is 38 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family, which consists of eight members. 

Awad has retired from the military and is currently studying for a Bachelor of History since he wasn’t able to study before because of his work. But, with his experience in work, he felt that it is necessary to get the Bachelor degree. He is also planning to expand his studies in the future to get a Master's degree. 

Since Awad is facing a financial crisis, he is asking for a loan to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 42 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family, which consists of four members. 

He is currently studying for a Bachelor of Political Science degree and working at an association. Mohammad wasn’t able to continue his study previously, since he spent his time only on work. But after his experience in work, he decided to continue his study. He is also planning to expand it by getting a Master's degree. 

Mohammad is facing financial crisis, so he is asking for a loan to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Ferdinan

texts.en:
Ferdinan is a 58-year-old man who is married to Martha, a 55-year-old woman. They are blessed with eight children. Five of them are married and live separately, while another three live with him.

Ferdinan runs a business selling fried cakes. He has been running the business for the past three years. This business enables him to pay for his family's daily needs and school fees. Ferdinan was thinking of producing more cakes and opening a kiosk business. In order to implement his plan, Ferdinan submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of 4,500,000 IDR. This loan assistance will help him to add various items to his kiosk business such as shampoo, detergent, biscuits, candies, wheat flour, cooking oil, instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase various items such as shampoo, detergent, biscuits, candies, wheat flour, cooking oil, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en: Julie Ann is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by rice farming in their simple village in the Philippines. She is borrowing a loan of 48,000 PHP that she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in the farming business for 10 years. In addition to farming, she also earns income by selling dry goods and vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga tiene 49 años de edad, esta acompañada y es madre de dos hijos. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura junto con su compañero de vida y uno de sus hijos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas para cultivar maíz y maicillo y para reparar una pared de su casa y construir un corredor a la casa. De esta manera, su casa será más segura y estará su familia más tranquila. Él manifiesta que seguirá trabajando en la agricultura y mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Olga is a 49-year old woman who lives with her partner and has two children. She has worked in agriculture for 15 years with her partner and one of her sons. 

She is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and pesticides to cultivate corn and sorghum, and to repair a wall and build a hallway in her house. Thanks to these improvements, her house will be safer and her family will live more peacefully. She says she plans to continue working in agriculture and improving her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and pesticides to cultivate corn and sorghum, and to repair a wall and build a hallway in her house.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara es una mujer de 62 años de edad, esta acompañada y procreo tres hijos; pero todos están casados. 25 años de experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y fríjol. Así, ella asegurara parte del alimento de su familia y la otra parte de la cosecha la venderá para obtener ingresos que los utilizara en otras necesidades del hogar.

Ella considera que seguirá cultivando más de lo que ya cultiva y seguir trabajando con fundación campo para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Genara is a 62-year-old woman. She is in a relationship and has 3 children, but they are all married. She has 25 years of experience growing corn and beans; she has always made her living through farming.
The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for labor to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. In this way, she will use part of the harvest to feed her family, and she will sell the rest of the harvest in order to make income that she will use for other household necessities.
She thinks that she will continue to plant more than she does now, and she will continue to work with Fundación Campo in order to have better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for labor to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and beans.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya was born in 1988. She lives in Amman, Jordan. Aya was facing financial challenges in the past, which encouraged her start her business selling blankets and housewares to her neighbors. As she found it profitable, she is now seeking a youth loan to open her own store and start expanding her business. In the future she plans to offer a workshop for sewing blankets, which will increase her income and help her cover her expenses.

loans.use: To open her own blankets store

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is 18 years old. She is single and lives in Mafraq, Jordan with her family, which consists of nine people. She is currently studying for her Bachelor of Nursing degree. Rawan is planning to continue her studies and get a master's degree in the future. As she is facing financial crisis, she is asking for a loan to pay for her school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina mujer de 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos.  Desde hace doce años se dedica a prestar sus servicios como sastre y como propietaria de su taller tiene siete años; esta actividad lo aprendió de su mamá quien se dedicaba a esta misma actividad. Vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 13 años y un hijo de 14 años de edad.

Los materiales que utiliza para la elaboración de productos como trapeadores para pisos y otros productos de uso en las amas de casa como gabachas delantales, ella necesita de tela la que adquiere en las diferentes comerciales de la ciudad y los traslada por medio de auto bus aproximadamente unos treinta y cinco kilómetros hasta su casa donde los fabrica; luego los traslada hacia la ciudad dos ciudades en donde los comercializa. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para la construcción de una habitación y para la compra de más tela para la sastrería.  Con el préstamo, tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, vivirá en mejores condiciones que en las que actualmente vive y también tendrá mayores ingresos económicos. 

Ella planea tener una vivienda que reúna las condicione para su familia y que sus hijos tengan una educación que les permita desempeñar una labor en cualquier institución o servicio que les permita tener sus ingresos para su sostenibilidad.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a 36-year old woman who has two children. She started working as a tailor 12 years ago and has owned her tailor shop for 7 years. She learned this profession from her mother. She lives with her husband and their children, a 13-year old daughter and a 14-year old son. 

She makes mops and other products that housewives use, such as aprons. In order to make these garments she needs fabric that she buys at different stores and brings back home by bus in approximately 35 minutes. Once made, she takes them to two different cities for sale. 

She plans to use the loan to build a room and to buy more fabric for her tailor shop. Thanks to this loan, she will improve her quality of life and increase her income. Her goal is to provide her family with a better home and her children with an education that will allow them to work in an institution or service in the future and to have income to support themselves.

loans.use: to build a room and to buy fabric for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Ráfael Humberto

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 46 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 10 años trabaja como vigilante. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para cambiar las puertas y el piso de la vivienda. De esta manera, tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, vivirá en mejores condiciones que en las que actualmente vive

Él desea, seguir mejorando su vivienda, y seguir trabajando con fundación campo, ya que la atención que le brindaron fue mejor de lo que él esperaba.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 46-year old man who lives with his partner and has three children. He has worked as a guard for 10 years. 

He is requesting a loan to change the doors and floor of his home. Thanks to these improvements, his family will have a better quality of life. His goal is to continue improving his house and to keep working with Fundación Campo, as the service he has received has exceeded his expectations.

loans.use: to change the doors and floor of his home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 45-year-old woman who is married to Petrus, a 68-year-old man. They have been blessed with three children: Dewi, 17, who is in the second grade of junior high school; Omega, 10, in fifth grade of elementary school; and Lori, 4.

Martha initiated a pig breeding business two years ago. She usually raises the pigs for seven to eight months before selling them. The selling price is around 3,500,000 IDR per pig, depending on the weight. The income from the business enables Martha to support the needs of her family. 

At the moment, Martha has two pigs to raise, and one of them is ready to be sold. She desires to purchase more piglets to raise and build a new pig stall; therefore she applied an individual loan from TLM amounting to 12,500,000 IDR. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and build a new pig stall

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 66 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, soft drinks, coconut wine and other groceries. 

In the future Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salim
