Avelina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable se siente agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar una mejor vida.
texts.en: Avelina is 56 years old and lives with her husband and her two children, as well as her two small grandchildren. She sells milk and has had several years of experience in her craft, which has taught her a lot, and has shown her the best ways to make money. Her business is located in her home and she also works as a street vendor. She is known by all the people in her neighborhood and has a large clientele because they all know that her products are high quality and sold at an affordable price while being backed up by an unparalleled service. Avelina is an active woman, dedicated to her business and hard working as she pushes herself everyday to make a better life for her family and to be successful in the future. She wants to continue improving her home and to install clay tile floors so she can have a cleaner and more comfortable home. She would also like to reinforce the existing roof. However, she doesn't have enough money to do it on her own and so she is asking for help from FUSAI, a micro-credit loan organization that will help her to purchase tiles, lumber, cement and other construction material. Avelina has good references and an untarnished moral. She is thankful for the help and assures us she will be able to pay off her debt while having the hopes of leading a happier life in her updated home.

loans.use: purchase tile, laminate, cement and lumber.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
This marks Cecilia's third borrowing from KADET Ltd, to purchase a motorcycle for supplying her detergents.

She hopes to reach her clients with ease, and expand on business by reaching many clients in the shortest time. 

She hopes to see her business grow bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Eucebia

texts.es:
Doña María Eucebia es una mujer de 32 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria, agricultora y ama de casa con un año de educación. Ella se dedica a la agricultora hace varios años con los cuales ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz, frijol y café lo cual aprendió de sus padres desde su infancia. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja trabaja es propio y su mayor cliente es IHCAFE (Instituto Hondureño de Café) quien compra la producción por completo de ser una producción de calidad y que llene los requisitos para su compra. 

Hoy en día ella solicita un apoyo financiero con el cual necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes y preparar la tierra para la siembra de nueva plantación la cual vendrá a mejorar sus cultivos en cantidad y los ingresos para su familia y hogar.  

Sus planes para el futuro son los de mejorar sus tierras abonándolas y haciendo de ellas tierras aptas para el producto que cultiva. Sus sueño como madre es preparar a sus hijos para que sean personas prosperas en la vida y poder mejorar su nivel de vida ya que con las ganancias ella planea re invertir en sus tierras y cumplir con su compromiso.
texts.en:
María Eucebia is 32 years old and has three children who are in different year groups at primary school. She is a farmer and homemaker with one year's education. She has worked in agriculture for many years, and has a lot of experience in growing maize, beans and coffee. She learned this from her parents from a young age. The land she farms with her partner is her own, and her biggest customer is IHCAFE (Honduran Institute of Coffee) which buys her entire crop because it is high-quality and meets the organisation's purchasing requirements.

Today, she is requesting a loan to buy compost and fertiliser, to prepare the land for more plants, which will increase her crop and boost earnings for her family and home. 

Her plans for the future are to improve her land by feeding it with compost and making it ready for the products she grows. Her dream as a mother is to prepare her children so that they find success in life, and improve their quality of life. With her earnings, she plans to reinvest in her land and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and prepare land to grow coffee.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, age 56, is a married woman. She works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Amina was not earning income, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner for the family, so she felt an obligation to help improve her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her to establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. Therefore, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested her 5th loan of Rs. 35,000. This will help Amina to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread in various colors. Her daughters also assist her in completing her customers' orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Anuradha Self Help Group

texts.en:
Haras is a 49-year-old lady living with her husband and a child. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffalos. She sells five litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of three persons. She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is more in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it big.

Haras, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 120,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to increase her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give quality life to her family and save some money for her child's future.

All the members of this group are engaged in dairy business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more cows and repairing her cattle shed.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a small scale vegetable seller and fishmonger in Ve-Deme (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a tailor. Janet has been running her food stand for close to 2 years. Her income is used to help her husband to pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish, garden eggs, tomatoes, canned tomatoes, and other cooking items, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish, garden eggs, tomatoes, canned tomatoes, and other cooking items.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is involved in selling smoked fish and vegetables in Ve-Deme (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a peasant farmer) support their 3 children. She has been involved in selling smoked and fried fish for 20 years now. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional amounts of fish, thus helping her sell more due to her increased inventory. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her fish business and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of fish.

loans.name: Mirna Adalila

texts.es:
Doña Mirna curso hasta la secundaria ya que se le hacía difícil trasladarse hasta el lugar donde estaba ubicada la institución en la que estudiaba para seguir sus estudios universitarios. Ella es viuda su esposo falleció hace dos años y es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales el mayor que tiene 20 años vive con su papa que fue el primer esposo,  el segundo vive con ella y curso hasta tercer curso pero además estudio un curso de carpintería, el tercer hijo vive con la abuela y está cursando el tercer curso de ciclo común, el cuarto hijo tiene 15 años y  está en  segundo curso en la misma localidad, el quinto hijo tiene 13 años y ella cursa el primer año de plan básico la cual vive con ella y el menor que tiene 2 años quien está a su cuidado. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña el trabajo de la tierra por medio de sus padres y la tierra que ella trabaja está ubicada a 45 minutos de sus casa de habitación a la cual se traslada a pie diariamente. En las actividades solo se involucran 3 de sus hijos ya que son su único apoyo en el campo.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar abono, fertilizantes, limpiar y dar asistencia y mantenimiento en general a sus cultivos de café los cuales son de una variedad llamada Lempira.  

Sus metas son aumentar el patrimonio que hoy tiene y poderles dejar una herencia digna a sus hijos esperado lograrlo con el apoyo financiero que ahora le está solicitando a COMIXMUL para el beneficio de su familia y así lograr seguir apoyándolos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mirna was only educated to secondary school level, as it was difficult to travel to where her school was to continue with university studies. She is a widow, as her husband died two years ago, and she has 6 children. Her eldest is 20 and lives with their father, her first husband. The second oldest lives with her and is in the third year of further studies, but also studied carpentry. Her third child lives with their grandmother, and is studying in the third year of higher education, her fourth child is 15 and is in the second year at the same place, and her fifth child is 13 and is in her first year. She lives with her along with the youngest, who is 2 and who is under her care. 

She learned how to farm the land from a young age from her parents, and her plot of land is located 45 minutes from her home. She walks there every day. Three of her children help her as they are her only support in farming. 

She has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to buy compost, fertiliser, clean, look after and maintain her coffee crops, which are the Lempira variety.

Her goal is to increase her assets so that she can leave her children a dignified inheritance. She hopes to achieve this through the loan she is requesting from COMIXMUL, which she will use to look after her family and continue supporting them in their studies.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en: Akhtar is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband (who is also shown in the photo) have been working in agriculture for many years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them at the local market.  Her husband assists her by watering the crops, in order to have high quality produce. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Akhtar applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. This would help her to grow more crops, ultimately helping generate more income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of pesticides.

loans.name: Mahaveer Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2012, ten women from Balipatna village stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named Mahaveer Self Help Group. The members of Mahaveer Self Help Group are all women from a district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Rinalata, who was selected as their president. The lady standing third from right hand side in the photo is Rinalata.

Rinalata is 31 years old and is staying with her husband. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband. She gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially she started with growing only a few vegetables, such as potatos, tomatoes and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, lady finger [okra] and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables large scale. For this, she has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing land, seeds, fertilizers, etc., for cultivation.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with 3 children. She received some schooling till the end of senior high school. Currently, Judith sells varieties of cloth in Ve-Deme (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this industry for about 5 years now. Her husband is a tailor. Judith’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Judith will use the loan to increase her existing cloth inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Judith plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing cloth inventory.

loans.name: Julio Ándres

texts.es:
Julio tiene 61 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 6 hijos.  Desde muy corta edad se dedica  a  la siembra de granos básicos actividad en la que fue instruido  por su padre, aunque a lo largo de su vida se ha desempeñado  en diversas tareas  con el afán de sacar a delante su familia, destaca dentro de ellas  el trabajo de  policía municipal; que  desde un tiempo  atrás realizo  pero  que actualmente decidió  alejarse de ella por el peligro  que esta conlleva, pensando dedicarse a las actividades agropecuarias  en las que  fue formado . 

Los insumos para  la siembra de granos básicos  los compra en una comunidad, teniendo  que transportarlos en pick up a 20 minutos para llevarlos hasta el lugar donde realiza los cultivos. 


El Préstamo será utilizado una parte para la compra de 5 sacos de abono, 3 litros de herbicidas y el resto para la compra de pollos de engorde  y concentrado  con el fin de incrementar los ingresos familiares. 

El préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida familiar; ya que proporcionara  la oportunidad de incrementar su unidad de producción lo cual estará generando mayor cantidad de ingresos económicos a la familia  y dará la oportunidad a los hijos que están cursando la educación básica de culminar al menos la educación media.
 
A futuro  piensa  incrementar la siembra de granos básicos, ya que ha sido  lo que toda su vida le ha brindado el alimento  a la familia; pero  a demás construirá  una galera para pollos de engorde con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos familiares  y así poder  crecer al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 61 years old. He is married and has six children.  From a very young age, he made a living growing basic grains.  He learned this trade from his father, though, throughout his life, he has worked in various jobs, with the aim of helping his family get ahead.  One of his jobs was working for the municipal police some time ago but he decided to leave this work because of the dangers it entailed.  He thus decided to return to the farming work that he is trained to work in.

Julio buys supplies for his basic grains in the community, having to transport them 20 minutes in a pick up truck to get them to the land where he grows his crops.

Part of this loan will be used to buy five bags of manure and three litres of herbicides.  The rest will be used to buy chickens to fatten up, and chicken feed, in order to increase the family income.

This loan will improve the family's quality of living as it will provide Julio with an opportunity to increase production, thus generating a higher income for the household.  This, in turn, will give Julio's children - currently in primary school - the opportunity to complete at least high school.

In the future, Julio is thinking about increasing his basic grain crops as this has always put food on the table for his family.  However, in addition, he would like to build a pen to fatten up chickens, increase his income and grow alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy five bags of manure and three litres of herbicides.  The rest will be used to buy chickens to fatten up, and chicken feed, in order to increase the family income.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 34-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of trading cloth for the past two years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. Rehana requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloths of the summer season. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths of the summer season.

loans.name: Felipa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Felipa de los Ángeles de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos uno de 13 años y una hija de 23, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina popular y a la ves a la venta de cosméticos para damas como labiales, esmaltes, cremas, entre otros tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar que calificó como bueno para su trabajo, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene los mejores productos, además de buenos precios, y un servicio excelente; Felipa es una mujer entregada a su labor, honrada y dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos, su mas grande secreto es la constancia y el apoyo que le brinda su familia, desde hace algún tiempo necesita invertir para la reparación del techo de su casa pues está deteriorado y eso le da inseguridad a los miembros del hogar; necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar  cemento, tejas, polines etc. Felipa de los Ángeles tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecida con la ayuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felipa de los Ángeles, 50, lives together with her life partner and two children: a 13-year-old son and a 23-year-old daughter. Felipa sells medicines and cosmetics for women, such as lipsticks, nail polish and creams. She has worked with this for several years, which has given her the opportunity to make good profits. She says that her establishment is located in a good place for business and that she has many customers that choose her because she offers the best products and prices and her service is excellent.

Felipa is devoted to her job. She is honest and willing to work hard in order to reach her goals. Her biggest secret is her perseverance and her family’s support. She needs to repair her house’s roof, since it is in bad shape and is unsafe for her family members. However, she does not have enough to do it and this is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy cement, roof tiles, beams, etc. Felipa de los Ángeles has a good payment record and promises to pay the loan responsibly. She appreciates the help and at the same time believes that she will be able to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, roof tiles and beams to repair her roof.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 44 year-old married woman.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way, she would be able to stitch up more dresses on time.  She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Francis decided to set up his own fashion design business in Ve-Deme (near Hohoe). With over 10 years worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him to purchase more thread, zippers, and cloth. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, zippers, and cloth

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra, a 41-year-old married mother of five children, successfully operates an animal purchase and sale business with the support of her husband, who buys baby goats and calves at low prices. Azra raises them, after which her husband (who is also shown in the photo) sells them in the market at higher prices. For the further improvement of the business, Azra has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase another goat. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase another goat.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en: This  marks Mwinyi's third borrowing after successfully servicing his loan well.  His business has since grown and he will use the requested loan to purchase a motorbike to help him reach more of his clients. He hopes to grow and create an employment to other youths who are jobless.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fruits and green vegetables for his fruit juice and greengrocery business

loans.name: Kumari Punam

texts.en:
Kumari Punam is a 26-year-old differently able woman. She lives with her parents and younger brother and sister. 

She has two years of experience in tailoring. She has one sewing machine. She stitches ladies clothes like blouses, frocks, uniforms of school girls, suits (traditional dress in Odisha), etc. She earns 2,000 INR per month from her business. 

She wants to help her father by sharing the expenditure of their family. She wants to develop her business and save some money for her family's future. She takes orders from the village people to make their dresses and she keeps only the charge for the tailoring. This gives less profit to her. She wants to make dresses using her own materials.

She wants to make dresses for children and girls that she can sell at festivals. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a new sewing machine, cloth, ribbons, buttons, etc. in bulk amount. Through this she will make dresses and earn a good amount by selling them. In this way she can earn 4,000 to 4,500 INR from this business and she can save some amount for her future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a sewing machine, cloth, ribbons, buttons, etc., in bulk amount.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been selling cloth for the past two years with the support of her husband. Nasreen buys cloth in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Nasreen is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

It’s her sixth loan cycle. Nasreen expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Bhagabat Basudev Mgr Group

texts.en:
Pramila is 41 and married. She has three children of whom all are in schooling. Her family lives in a village of the Khurda District in Odisha, India. 

She and her husband earn a living through working as farmers and cultivating rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 3,000 INR per month to meet her family’s needs. 

Pramila is leading a group named Bhagabat Basudev Mgr. Its 11 members are applying for the loan with Peoples' Forum. The members of Bhagabat Basudev Mgr are engaged in different kind of activities like agriculture, general store, dairy farm, wood business. 

Pramila is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland.

loans.name: Life Group

texts.en:
The Life Group consists of two members who live in the same neighborhood. This will be their second loan from Kiva and their fifth from ID-Ghana in order to raise their level of activity.

Lydia, the group's representative, is a 55-year-old divorced woman taking care of two of her sister's children, both of whom are in school. She is standing on the left in the photograph. Educated to the secondary level, Lydia has been selling bags for the past six years. Now requesting a loan of GHS 1500 to purchase more bags from the wholesale market to satisfy the needs of her customers, she will use the new resulting profits to repay this loan.

Grace, her group partner, sells wigs.

loans.use: To procure bags from the wholesale market

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 44 years old and married.

She has been running a business purchasing, raising and selling animals for the past five years. She buys baby animals at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent a life. 

She has four goats and two sheep. She requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a married man, and he lives in his own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. He operates a bodaboda (motorcycle transport) business. He is a very self-sacrificing man, and his business is doing well. He is requesting a loan of KSH 25,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle to facilitate the efficiency of his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace operates a local Fufu joint in Ve-Deme (near Hohoe). Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a paste made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle until the desired consistency is reached. The malleable dough is served and eaten with a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, palm oil fruit soup or other soups. She has been educated until the end of middle school. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a businessman. Peace has been working in this enterprise for four years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels of FuFu ingredients. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her food and hospitality business and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of FuFu ingredients

loans.name: Santoshi Upkar Self Help Group

texts.en:
Santoshi Upkar Self Help Group consists of eight women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves.
 
One of them is Swarna Lata, who was selected as president of Santoshi Upkar Self Help Group. The members of the group are mostly engaged in dairy businesses. The lady siting first from left hand side in the photo is Swarna Lata. 

Swarna Lata is 31 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. She hopes to see her children as officers in a big company. She has a few cows and she sells milk in the village. Her husband supports her in this activity.
 
Swarna Lata and her group members have requested a loan of 104,000 INR. Her portion will help her to purchase a cow and repair her cow shed and to cover operational expenses like food and fodder for the cows.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and repair her cow shed and to cover operational expenses like food and fodder for cows.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, a rural villager from Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district, is 48 years old. She has earned a living through planting corn and rice for almost 15 years. Srey is able to save up to 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the third loan cycle for Srey with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her son's education. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for her son's education.

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Nay is 41 years old and married. She has a rented booth where she operates a fish-vending business. She usually sells her fish in the morning time because there are a lot of people visiting the market. She has been in the business for almost six years and is able to make a net profit of $5.00 per day. Aside from her commerce, she takes care of the household and contributes to the everyday expenses. 

She learned about HKL through a loan officer, and this will be her second loan after successfully paying off the previous loan. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase more fish to sell. With the profit she hopes to make from her investment, she wants to expand and diversify her business in order to satisfy her customers’ needs, and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Ms. Kishwar is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has been running a business of making and selling samosas, a dish consisting of pieces of vegetables and chicken dipped in gram (chickpea) flour. She is an expert in making good tasting samosas at home and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. 

In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase ingredients in a large quantity. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy stock of gram flour along with packs of oil and spices. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation since six years ago and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of gram (chickpea) flour along with packs of oil and spices.

loans.name: Nirmaladevi Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rasmi is 27 years old, married and has one child. She lives in the village of Balipatna in Odisha, India. Rasmi is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. 

She has a business of growing vegetables and rice and selling them in the market of the Khurda district of Odisha. She already has had this business for three years, and it is going very well. 

At this time, Rasmi is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. 

Nirmaladevi Self Help Group is made up of neighbours and friends. The members of the group have selected Rasmi as their president. The lady sitting second from right hand side in the first row in the photo is Rasmi. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Maa Jagat Janani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Jagat Janani Self Help Group is consisting of nine women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves.
 
One of them is Satyabhama, who was selected as the president of Maa Jagat Janani Self Help Group. The lady standing fifth from right side in the photo is Satyabhama. 

Satyabhama is 47 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children who are in schooling. She hopes to see them as successful persons in their lives. She has a few acres of land in her village and she is using her land in vegetable and paddy cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She and her group have requested a loan of 126,000 INR. Her portion will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation -- vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides -- and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 31 years old and from Tulkarem. He owns a greenhouse in which he has planted vegetables since 2008.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order make a new greenhouse and plant more vegetables. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the productivity and thus, increase the sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to make a new greenhouse and plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old. He is married to Jacinta and a father of two children. Daniel lives in Kawangware, in the outskirts of Nairobi. For the past five years, he has hawked household items and earns a monthly income of 400,000 KES. 

Daniel is requesting his third KADET LTD loan to purchase thermoses, blankets, hot pots, and mosquito nets to resell. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase thermoses, blankets, hot pots, and mosquito nets

loans.name: Tulibamu Group

texts.en:
Evas is 37 years old, a single mother of six children, age 12, 9, 8, 7, 2 and 1 year old. 

She is a food vender in Kagadi central market and it is from this business that Evas gets money to look after the family. 

She borrowed a loan of UGX 100,000 from Ugafode to add into business and it helped her to increase the capital she had by then.

Evas now wants another loan of UGX 200,000 to invest more in her food vending business so that she can realize more returns and meet the demand for her products.

Eva's dream is to use the proceeds from her business to educate her children up to higher institutions of learning. But this appears to be a challenge for her since the business is still small, so she wants the lenders to keep supporting her financially.

loans.use: To buy food that she will cook and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Samrong district of Takeo province, Sokhoern is aged 37 years and married. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She has been working in a garment factory for 18 years, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. With her current work, she is able to earn approximately 14,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to support her family. 

Sokhoern has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sokhoern will use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She will need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use so as to improve to a healthier standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Saven's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Saven is aged 49 years and married. She has three children. 

To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for almost 30 years. The current business earns her family about 21,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Saven is just with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Saven is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district
